Milk from the cows is sold, providing a stable monthly income for the family, and then once the calves reach 18 months old they too will be sold. To provide animals with food he works two hectares of land, which he inherited from his father. 

Now he is facing a major problem: the shelter for the cows is too small. Right now the calves stay out in the open during the day but at night or when it rains they are housed in the small shelter. At the moment they are all able to fit but as the calves grow and get older, half of them will be without shelter. To solve this problem, Victor needs a loan to build a stable. The stable will enable him to increase the number of cows he can raise at one time. As he increases the amount of cows he can raise, he will be able to bring in more revenue, which could result in the creation of new jobs for the community.

loans.use: To pay for a stable to shelter his cows.

loans.name: Mikailu

texts.en: Mikailu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Mikailu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Mikailu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mikailu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds, which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mikailu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Herminda De Jesus

texts.es:
Herminda está soltera pero ya tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están viviendo con ella y el otro vive junto a su papá, solo uno de ellos estudia pues los otros dos están pequeños.

Herminda tiene una tienda en casa de sus padres y es esa su principal fuente de ingresos para pagar sus estudios y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar platos, vasos, tenederos descartables, un quintal de azúcar, uno de maíz y harina para surtir su tienda.

Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y poner a disposición de todos sus clientes todos los productos de la canasta básica y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Herminda is single and has three children, two of whom live with her. Her other son lives with his dad. One of them studies; the other two are still too young. 

Herminda runs a store in her parents' house, which is her main source of income to cover tuition expenses and get ahead with the kids. She needs the loan to buy plates, glasses, plastic forks, sugar, corn and flour for her store. 

Her dream is to expand the business and to provide her clients with all the basic products, as well as clothes for women, men and children.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, plastic forks, sugar, corn and flour for her store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 32 años de edad es licenciado en computación, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en un hospital nacional, tienen un hijo de tres años de edad que aún no asiste a la escuela.

Carlos es empleado, trabaja en una escuela cercana en un horario de 7:00 AM  a 4:00 PM lo cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y con lo que mantiene a su familia.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar repuestos y reparar su vehículo y que es su herramienta indispensable para transportarse.

Su sueño es poder comprar los medicamentos para su hijo para mantener en buen estado su salud y darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old and graduated in computer science. He lives with his partner, who works in a national hospital, and their 3-year old son, who does not attend school yet. Carlos works in a nearby school from 7am to 4pm, which is their main income source to cover household expenses. 

He is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts and to repair his vehicle, which is his indispensable tool to move around. 

His dream is to be able to buy medicines for his son so that he can keep his good health and to provide him with everything he might need.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos tienen cuatro hijos de las edades de 9, 6, 5 y 3 años los cuales viven en su casa y actualmente estudian.

Eusebio trabaja en una institución que ayuda a las  comunidades de escasos recursos económicos, él es el encargado de capacitar en talleres manuales y vocacionales, tiene ya  seis años de trabajar en esta institución,  comenta que entró a trabajar ahí gracias a su deseo de ayudar a las personas en diferentes áreas  y fue así como él tuvo la oportunidad.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar 2 sacos de abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes para obtener buenas cosechas de maíz y frijol.

   
Eusebio planea para un futuro poder ampliar más su vivienda, también no descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando y apoyar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a 36-year old man who studied up to high-school. He lives with his wife, who does housework at their home, and their 4 children, aged 9, 6, 5 and 3. They all live at home and attend school. Eusebio works in an institution that supports poor communities. He is in charge of the training in manual and vocational workshops and has 6 years of experience with them. He started in the job following his dream to help people in different areas and found this opportunity. 

He is requesting this loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizer and insecticide so that they can obtain good harvest of corn and beans. Eusebio plans to expand his house and also considers the possibility of studying and supporting his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of fertilizer and insecticide so that he can obtain good harvests of corn and beans.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la albañilería y la agricultura, tienen tres hijos, todos viven en la misma casa.

Evelyn, tiene un negocio de verduras desde hace quince años, lo aprendió de su madre quien se ha dedicado a este negocio desde que ella estaba pequeña, el hijo más grande de Evelyn, le ayuda después que llega de la escuela.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos cerdos y para compra de insumos agrícolas, de esa manera lograra mejora su calidad de vida para ella y su familia, pues tendrá ingresos adicionales.
 
El sueño de Evelyn, es continuar con su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and has a fourth-grade education. She is married; her husband works in the building and farming trades. The couple has three children, all of whom live at home.

Evelyn has had a business selling groceries for 15 years. She learned this trade from her mother, who has done this work since she was a girl. Evelyn’s eldest son helps her after school.

Evelyn needs this loan to buy two pigs and farming supplies. This will help Evelyn to improve her and her family’s quality of life as these items will provide her with an additional income.

Evelyn’s dream is to continue with her business and for her children to continue in education so that they may learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and farming supplies.

loans.name: Bladimer José

texts.es: Residente en un barrio al Sur Occidente del municipio de Barranquilla, Bladimer de 51 años tiene en arriendo dos apartamentos que construyo al presentársele la oportunidad de adquirir un lote cerca de su casa. Él labora en una empresa hace 25 años y consideró que al realizar estas inversiones podría solidificar su economía familia y generar recursos adicionales.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con el que planea ofrecer una mejor estadía a sus arrendatarios mediante adecuaciones, para ello invertirá en materiales de construcción como cemento, block, baldosín y pintura. A largo plazo se propone cumplir su ideal de continuar adquiriendo predios para arrendar y crecer cada vez más en su negocio.  Bladimer es padre de tres hijos a quienes ofreció bienestar y aún continua apoyando, su meta familiar es ver a su hija realizada profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Resident of a neighborhood to the South West of Barranquilla, Bladimer is a 51-year old man who rents two apartments that he built after seizing a good buying opportunity near his house. He has been working for the same company for 25 years and thought that these investments would help his family finances and provide additional income. 

He is requesting his first Credikiva, which he will use to provide his tenants with a better stay. He plans to buy construction materials, such as cement, blocks, tiles and paint. His long-term goal is to keep buying apartments to rent and to expand his business. 

Bladimer has 3 children, whom he supported and still does. His family goal is to see her daughter turn into a professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, blocks, tiles and paint.

loans.name: Tionkon

texts.fr: Agé de 49 ans éleveur malien ,  père de 05 enfants, sont âges de 15 à 3 ans dont 03 sont  à l’école. Sa femme fait le ménage. Il fait cette activité depuis 14 ans, dans l’avenir il a comme rêve d’améliore l’éducation de ses enfants et la santé. Pour que tout cela soit réalisé il demande l’aide crédit à l’IMF  en vue de générer plus de profit pour un lendemain meilleur, Tionkon s’approvisionne dans le marché locale en bœufs et après avoir les élevés il les revend, ses méthodes de ventes sont très rentables tout en réalisant  des bénéfices qui varient entre 100000  à  150000f par cycles tête. Il est confronté souvent à quelques obstacles sur le marché  la chute des prix. Son plaisir dans cette activité est qu’elle lui permet  d’avoir des engrais organiques.
texts.en: Tionkon is a 49 year-old Malian who raises animals; he is father to five children, who range from three to 15 years of age, and three of the children are at school. His wife does housework. He has been carrying out this activity for the past 14 years and he dreams of being able to improve his children's education and healthcare in the future. In order to achieve this dream he is requesting a loan from the IMF so that he can generate more profit for a better future. Tionkon gets his supplies of bulls in the local market, and once he has raised them he sells them on. His selling methods are very profitable and he makes profits of between 100,000 and 150,000 francs per cycle. He is often confronted by problems in the market and a fall in prices. The particular pleasure he derives from this activity is that it enables him to get organic fertlilizers.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening and selling on.

loans.name: Antonia Claribel

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado debido a tantas dificultades económicas en su familia le fue imposible seguir estudiando, ella está acompañada y su esposo es agricultor,  tienen tres de los cuales solo dos van a la escuela.

Antonia se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además elabora para vender y así obtiene ingresos para su familia, también desde hace 4 años vende productos para las damas como maquillajes, cremas, labiales, brillos y todo lo relacionado con cosméticos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 225 varas de tusa, 4 cuartones y pagará mano de obra para reparar el techo de su casa.

En un futuro ella quiere obtener un crédito más grande para poner el piso a su casa, construir más cuartos y así tener una vivienda más amplia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 31 years old. She was in school up to the seventh grade, but due to the economical difficulties in her family, it was impossible for her to continue her studies. She lives with her common-law husband, who is a farmer. They have three children, two of which attend school. 

Antonia is a domestic worker who also makes things to sell. This is how she earns income for her family. For the last 4 years she has also been selling products for women, such as makeup, lotion, lipstick, lip gloss and anything related to cosmetics. 

She needs the loan to buy 225 lengths of tusa (a building material made from corn husks), 4 wooden beams, and to pay for labor costs to repair the roof of her house.

In the future she hopes to take out a bigger loan to put a floor in her house and build more rooms so that she can have a larger home.

loans.use: to buy 225 lengths of tusa (a building material made from corn husks), 4 wooden beams, and to pay for labor costs to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou est un éleveur de bœufs malien alphabétisé à l’école coranique âgé de 58 ans, père de 05 enfants dont 03 fréquente l’école ils sont âgés de 23 à16 ans, sa conjointe fait le ménage.
Son rêve est de  construire son terrain en dur, à cause des soucis de fonds nécessaires pour le bon déroulement de son élevage de bœufs  il fait recourt à IMF pour avoir plus de fonds en vue de pouvoir bien mener son élevage de bœufs. Il achète ses bœufs dans les foires locales et après avoir  les élevés, il les vend aux comptants et les bénéfices lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants en santé, éducation, habillements.
Il bénéficie en moyenne  150000f par cycle de prêt, il a confirmé  qu’il a eu rarement de difficultés  lors de la vente de ses bœufs.
texts.en:
Mamadou, who raises cattle, is 58 years old, literate and educated in a Koranic school; he is father to three children, three of whom are at school, and their ages range from 16 to 23 years old. His wife does the housework.

His dream is to build a permanent house on his land. In order to have the necessary funds to carry out his cattle-raising activity, he is turning to the IMF to get more money. He buys his bulls in local fairs and once he has raised them, he sells them for cash, and the profits enable him to improve his children's living conditions, including their healthcare, education and clothing. He makes around 150,000 francs of profit on average per loan cycle and confirms that he has rarely had any difficulties in selling his cattle.

loans.use: to buy bulls and sell them on.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio es un joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos domésticos en su hogar y a cuidar de su pequeño hijo de un año de edad.

Cornelio se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de jarcia, hamacas, lazos, matates etc. el trabajo es hereditario  pues desde que estaba pequeño se dedica a esta actividad gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron a elaborar estas artesanías, los productos que elabora los distribuye  en el pueblo más cercano donde tiene que cargar los bultos para  transportarlos en el bus, además, Cornelio se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol y su esposa le ayuda en los trabajos que realiza.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar semillas, 3 sacos de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, pagar mano de obra y preparar la tierra donde va a cultivar de maíz y frijol.  

Su sueño es ampliar más su producción de jarcia, poder comercializar en otros pueblos, le gustaría retomar sus estudios, tener su propia casa y espera lograrlo con dedicación.
texts.en:
Cornelio is a 25 year old man. He went to school up to the eighth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home and cares for their one year old son.

Cornelio makes artisanal crafts out of rope such as hammocks, lassos, bags, etc. He inherited this work because since he was young he has done this activity, thanks to his parents, who taught him to make these crafts. He distributes the crafts he makes to the closest town where he has to carry the packs to transport them in bus. In addition, Cornelio works in agriculture. He grows basic grains such as corn and beans, and his wife helps him with the work he does. 

He needs this loan to buy seeds, 3 bags of compost, insecticide, and fertilizer, as well as to pay for the labor and prepare the soil where he is going to grow the corn and beans.

His dream is to expand his rope production more, so he can sell it in other towns. He would like to go back to school and own his own home. He hopes to do this with hard work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, 3 bags of compost, insecticide, and fertilizer, as well as to pay for labor and prepare the soil where he is going to grow the corn and beans.

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
José, de 74 años de edad, no estudio porque su familia no lo apoyo, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos pero ninguno dependen de ellos, porque todos están acompañados. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, él tiene ganado y vende la leche desde hace más de 20 años, en el trabajo se involucra uno de sus nietos. 

José, necesita el crédito para comprar comida para el ganado y así cubrir esa necesidad, ya que se le ha escaseado la comida.

Los sueños de José, son que su familia prospere y que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, también mi sueño es tener más ganado.
texts.en:
José is 74 years old. He didn't go to school because his family didn't support him. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have three children but none of them are dependent on them, because they are married.

José works in agriculture and ranching. He has cattle and  has sold milk for more than 20 years. One of his grandchildren is involved in the work.  

José needs the loan to buy cattle feed, because food for the cattle has become scarce. 

José's dream is for his family to prosper and for them to have a better quality of life. He also dreams of having more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: José Salomón

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de primaria en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 14, 13 y 9 años de edad los cuales estudian en la escuela y dependen de José.  


Él se dedica a la agricultura, su padre le enseñó este trabajo desde pequeño cuando lo llevaba al campo, no tiene un horario específico pues siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus cultivos y sus hijos son quienes le ayudan de vez en cuando.

José utilizará el crédito para comprar 4 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, preparar la tierra y pagar mano de obra para llevar a cabo la siembra de granos básicos.
 

Él sueña con tener mejores cosechas para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y ampliar más su casa.
texts.en:
José is 59 years old. He studied until the third grade of primary school. He is married and his partner is a housewife. He has four children who are 17, 14, 13 and 9 years old who are studying in school and depend on José. He works as a farmer. His father taught him this trade when he was young when he would bring him to the fields. He does not have a specific schedule because he always has to tend to his crops and his children are the ones who help him from time to time. 

José will use the loan to purchase four sacks of manure, fertilizers and insecticides, to prepare the earth, and to pay for manual labor to complete the planting of basic grains. He dreams of having better harvests in order to increase his economic earnings and expand his home.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of manure, fertilizers and insecticides, to prepare the earth, and to pay for manual labor to complete the planting of basic grains.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería en  construcción, aún no tiene hijos y por lo tanto solo ella y su esposo viven en casa.

Yesenia siempre se  ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, además ahora trabaja en un comedor y atendiendo una tienda de productos básicos, esto lo hace por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Ella está solicitando este préstamo para comprar 500 tejas, 10 cuartones de madera y también pagará mano de obra para reparar el techo de su casa, esto le servirá de mucho pues ya no ingresará el agua a su casa durante las lluvias.
 
Ella sueña con seguir estudiando en la universidad pues le llama la atención la carrera de laboratorio clínico y espera procrear dos hijos junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old. She completed high school. Now she is married and her husband works as a bricklayer in construction. She doesn't have any children yet and so only she and her husband live at home. 

Yesenia has always taken cafe of the home, and now she also has a restaurant serving basic food. She does this to help her husband cover the household expenses. 

She is asking for this loan to buy 500 tiles, 10 wooden planks and pay for the labor to repair the roof on her house. This will be very useful to her because water won't leak into the house anymore when it rains.
 
She dreams of going to college, because she is interested clinical laboratory work. She also hopes to have two children with her husband.

loans.use: to buy 500 tiles, 10 planks of wood and pay for the labor to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, de 33 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, también es la albañilería, tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando y viven con ellos.

Rosibel, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también apoya a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas.

Rosibel, necesita el crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de  su vivienda, específicamente comprara cemento, madera, clavos, entre otros, para reparar el techo porque está muy dañado.

Rosibel, desea poder seguir ayudándole  en el estudio a sus  hijos, para  que  puedan estudiar en la universidad; también, desea poder  ampliar su casa y construir un cuarto más.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 33 years old. She is married and her spouse is a farmer. He is also a bricklayer. They have two children who are in school and live with them.  

Rosibel does the housework and she also helps her husband with the farming activity.

Rosibel needs the lo to improve the infrastructure of her home, specifically to buy cement, wood, nails, and more, to repair the roof, because it is very damaged.

Rosibel wants to be able to keep helping her children with their education, so that they can go to college. She also wants to expand her house and build another room.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña, una comunidad donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de patos, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 2 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in her own house in a large community in the urban area of Zaña. Its residents work in agriculture, trade and raising animals. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She raises and sells ducks. She has been doing this activity for more than 2 years, so she has experience in the business and good personal and work references in her district. She is asking for the loan to buy more animals and feed to raise them. This way, she hopes to grow her business more, obtain more income and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Yesenia Aracely

texts.es:
Yesenia es una joven muy trabajadora  de 20 años edad que estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado, tiene solo un hijo de 3 años de edad. 
		 
Yesenia se dedica a impartir clases de alfabetización a grupos de personas mayores, ya tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad pues es algo que le gusta mucho enseñar a leer y a escribir a personas que no han tenido la oportunidad de estudiar, el trabajo lo obtuvo gracias a una amiga que la recomendó, su horario es de 3:00 pm a 5:00 pm y el lugar donde enseña está cerca de su casa.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes, pagar mano de obra y preparar la tierra para sembrar granos básicos.

Ella sueña con sacar una carrera universitaria, tener otro hijo y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a hardworking young woman. She is 20 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. She is in a relationship; her partner is an employee. She only has a three-year-old son.

Yesenia teaches elderly people how to read and write. She has been doing it for two years, and she really enjoys teaching people that did not have the opportunity to study how to read and write. She got the job thanks to a friend who recommended her. She works from 3:00 pm until 5:00 pm, not far from where she lives.

She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor needed to prepare her land to sow cereals. Her dream is to receive a university degree, have another child and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor needed to prepare her land to sow cereals.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Oumarou est l’homme à la droite tenant entre ses mains la corde attaché au mouton. 
Oumarou est un malien âgée de 26 ans, marié père d’un enfant âgé d’un an (01) et sa femme fait le ménage à la maison.
Oumarou est un éleveur de moutons depuis 5 ans  n’ayant pas assez de fonds crédits pour le progrès de son élevage de moutons  fait recours à l’IMF pour avoir accès à un financement plus adéquate dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons et de tirer plus de  profits pour le bien être de sa famille :   en santé, éducation et  revêtement.
Il s’approvisionne dans les foires locales en marchandises (moutons) et après approvisionnement il les revend  aux comptants, il maitrise  son activité ce qui lui permet de faire plus de profits et il réalise  un bénéfice prévisionnel acceptable qui  varie entre 25000 à 80000f. Oumarou a souvent quelques obstacles sur le marché tel que : la chute des prix sur le marché et la mévente.
texts.en:
Oumarou is the man to the right in the photo holding on to the sheep.

Oumarou is 26 years old and he is from Mali. He is a married father to one child who is 12 months old. His wife looks after his household. Oumarou has been raising sheep for the past five years. As he did not have enough funds to further develop his sheep rearing business, he turned to IMF in order to gain access to more adequate funding so he could purchase more sheep and earn a greater profit. He wants to do this to ensure his family's well-being, by looking after their health, their education and providing them with clothing.

He gets his livestock from the local sheep markets, then after raising them he sells them on for cash. He knows everything about his business, which allows him to make greater profits. He earns an acceptable provisional profit which varies between 25,000 and 80,000 FCFA. Oumarou often encounters a few obstacles at market, such as falling market prices and slumps in sales.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise then sell

loans.name: Doré Flabio

texts.es:
Doré de 51 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, debido a que la zona en la que vive fue una de las más afectadas por la guerra en El Salvador y eso no le permitió continuar con sus estudios. Está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos,  3 viven aún en su casa y estudian y el mayor vive aparte.

Doré se dedica a la agricultura, tiene problemas de salud pero paga mano de obra para que le ayuden, el lugar donde trabaja está a 25 minutos de su casa y lo hace de 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm.
 

Él solicita este crédito para pagar mano de obra, comprar semillas, fertilizantes y otros insumos necesarios para sus cultivos, 

Él sueña con seguir trabajando duro en la agricultura y apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Doré, 51, studied up to the fourth grade, since he lives in one of the areas that were more affected by the war in El Salvador, which was an obstacle for him to continue with his studies. He is in a relationship and has four children. Three still live with him and go to school. The eldest son does not live with him.

Doré works in agriculture. He has health problems, but he pays someone to help him. He works from 6:00 am until 1:00 pm in a place located 25 minutes from where he lives.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labor, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies he needs for his plantations. His dream is to continue working hard in agriculture and support his children with anything they might need.

loans.use: to pay for labor, and buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies he needs for his plantations.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin nació en una comunidad llamada las nubes número uno en el año de 1984 , a los 7 años empezó a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad solo estudió hasta tercer grado,luego se dedicó a trabajar con el padre en labores de agricultura, pero también comenta Marvin que trabajaba en las propiedades cercanas donde el vivía, recuerda que en las temporadas de corte de café se iba a cortar café con la familia. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, comenta Marvin que apoyara a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta donde el pueda, porque dice que el estudio es lo mejor que puede existir. El trabaja en fincas o propiedades cercanas en construcción de casas y beneficios de café, hace trabajo de campo , también en los cortes de café se dedica a cortar con sus familia y hace otro dinerito.En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación y será de gran provecho ya que los hijos están estudiando y hacen tareas que le dejan en clase por las noches y para los cortes de café se tiene que levantar temprano para alistarse y trasladarse a cortar café, también se la señora se levanta temprano y se tiene que estar alumbrando con candelas y foco para alistarle la comida cuando él está haciendo algún trabajo en alguna propiedad cercana, pero ya teniendo un panel solar se podrá alumbrar de manera diferente y los hijos podrán trabajar con facilidad y mayor comodidad las tareas que le dejan de clase, la señora se alumbrara en la cocina con luz producida por el panel solar.
texts.en:
Marvin was the first child born in 1984 in a community called "the clouds." When he was 7 years old he began to study at the community school. He only completed the third grade and later dedicated himself to working with his father as a farmer. However, Marvin also told us that he worked for businesses nearby where he lived. He remembers that during the coffee harvesting season he would go to harvest coffee with his family. Currently, he is married and has four children. Marvin says that he will support his children with their studies for as long as he can because studying in the best thing that exists. He works on farms or on nearby properties constructing homes and harvesting coffee and performing farm labor. Also, during the coffee harvesting season he harvests coffee with his family to make a little extra money. 

In this community there is no electricity and it is because of this that he is seeking a loan to purchase a solar system which will be installed on his home which will provide a great benefit now that his children are studying and doing their homework that they have after class at night. In addition, to harvest coffee he needs to get up early to get ready and get moving. His wife also gets up early and she has to light the house with candles and focus to prepare their meals when he is working on a job at a local property. Having a solar panel will provide light in a different way and his children will be able to easily work with more comfort on their homework from their classes and his wife will light the kitchen with light produced by the solar panel.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, solo vive con dos nietos.

María, tiene una tienda y un molino desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, decidió dedicarse ha esto porque vio la oportunidad en la colonia donde vive, porque en ese tiempo no habían tiendas ni molinos cerca.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar productos de la canasta básica para vender en la tienda.

Los sueños de María, son hacer su casa más grande y que sus nietos puedan estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en: María is 63 years old. She studied until the second grade. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. They only live with two grandchildren. María has had a store and a mill for approximately 15 years. She decided to dedicate herself to this work because she saw an opportunity in the town where she lives because at that time there were no mills nearby. María needs this loan to purchase basic food products to sell at her store. María dreams of expanding her home and that her grandchildren will be able to study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase basic food products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH représente le groupe SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 04 ans. Il va à l’école (maternelle).
Mme ne vend plus du combustible mais fait maintenant la restauration depuis 05 mois. Elle s’approvisionne au marché son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de riz et 01sac de maïs pour sa restauration.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Azila Judith represents the Sababougnouma Group. She is in good health. She is a married mother of one child aged four years old. He currently attends nursery school. She no longer sells firewood, but she has been working in the food industry for the past five months. She gets her supplies from her local market. She wants to purchase one bag of rice and one bag of maize for her business. She wants to reinvest the profits back into her business. Azila Judith's ambition is to grow her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of rice and one bag of maize for their business

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
María es una señora de 59 años de edad, ella no sabe leer ni escribir pues no estudió debido a la situación económica de su familia, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene ocho hijos que ya son mayores de edad y están casados, en su casa viven cuatro personas, dos nietos su esposo y ella.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde que era pequeña su madre le enseñó este oficio, además ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta básica y un molino para maíz el  cual les  da ingresos económicos para mantenerse y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito le servirá a María para comprar 5 sacos de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes y granos preparados para sembrar, además preparará la  tierra.

Ella planea ampliar su tienda, ayudar a sus nietos para que estudien y puedan obtener una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
María is a 59 year old woman. She doesn't know how to read or write because she didn't go to school due her family's financial situation. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has 8 children and they are married. Four people live in her house, two grandchildren, her husband, and her. 

María takes care of the house work. Her mother taught her how to do this from the time she was little. She also has a small store in her home where she sells staple products, as well as a corn mill, which brings in income to support herself and help her husband with the household expenses.  

This loan will be useful to María for buying 5 bags of compost, insecticide, fertilizer, and seed ready to plant. She will also prepare the soil. 

She plans on expanding her land, and helping her grandchildren so they can go to school and graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of compost, insecticide, fertilizer and seed ready to plant. She will also prepare the soil.

loans.name: Selvin Nahun

texts.es:
Selvin es un joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo grado en la escuela debido a que su padre necesitaba que le ayudara en sus trabajos agrícolas, está acompañado y su pareja  se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad  y por lo tanto solo el mayor estudia.

Selvin se dedica a la albañilería, aprendió esto trabajando como ayudante, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 2:00 PM además siempre que puede él realiza trabajos agrícolas de modo que tiene diferentes fuentes de ingresos para su familia.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar 3 sacos de abono, pagar mano de obra y preparar la tierra para sembrar maíz.

Él sueña con retomar sus estudios pues piensa que nunca es tarde para hacerlo, remodelar su casa y darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Selvin, 25, is a young man who studied up to the second grade because his father needed him to help him to work the land. He is in a relationship. His partner works as a housekeeper. He has two children aged 5 and 1, which means that only the eldest one is in school.

Selvin works as a mason. He learned when he worked as an assistant. He works from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm. In addition, when he can, he works in agriculture, which means that he has different sources of income to support his family.

He needs this loan to buy three bags of fertilizer, and pay for the labor needed to prepare his land to sow corn. His dream is to start studying again; he thinks it is never too late to do it. Also, to remodel his house and give his children anything they might need.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer, and pay for the labor needed to prepare his land to sow corn.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 24 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, es madre soltera, solo tiene un hijo y vive con sus padres.

Isabel, tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, principalmente en la siembra de granos básicos, el maíz que cosecha lo comercializa en los mercados de la zona, siendo muy reconocida por muchos compradores.

Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a Isabel, para que compre pesticidas para preparar la tierra, con esto mejorar su producción y la proteger de las plagas.

Ella, espera quiere ahorrar las ganancias de la comercialización de los granos básicos, para hacer una tomatera en el futuro.
texts.en:
24-year-old Isabel is a young entrepreneur. She is single and has a son. She lives with her parents.

Isabel has worked in agriculture for more than ten years, mainly growing basic grains. She sells the corn she grows at different local markets and is well-known among customers.

This loan will help Isabel to buy pesticides to prepare the land. This will improve her production and protect her crops from plagues.

She wants to save the money she makes from selling basic grains in order to start growing tomatoes in the future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides to prepare her land.

loans.name: Abdulkadiri

texts.en: Abdulkadiri is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Abdulkadiri joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Abdulkadiri suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase his farmland. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Abdulkadiri has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support Abdulkadiri can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en: Kasimu is a Babban Gona farmer from Bamiyayi Vilage. Kasimu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Kasimu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Kasimu would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Kaka Yohanna

texts.en: Kaka is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Nabai Village. Kaka joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Kaka suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Kaka will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Kaka now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm’s yields.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a Babban Gona farmer from Nabai Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yohana no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yohana  now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tunkuna Village. Amadu  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Amadu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Amadu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Amadu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, desde pequeño tuvo que trabajar muy duro y por eso no pudo prepararse académicamente, está soltero y vive con su padre y 3 hermanos.

José trabaja como albañil, ya tiene 5 años de trabajar independientemente, la actividad la aprendió con uno de sus hermanos, su horario es de 6:00 AM a 2:00 PM y además siempre que puede él cultiva hortalizas como pepinos, tomates, chiles, etc. pues es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos para él y su familia.

Este crédito le ayudará a José para comprar un rollo de maya protectora de insectos, fertilizantes, reparar un sistema de riego por goteo para la siembra de hortalizas.

Él sueña con seguir estudiando una carrera de ingeniería civil, construir su propia casa y formar una familia.
texts.en:
José, 25 years old, has had to work very hard since he was little, and as such was not able to pursue academic training. He is unmarried and lives with his father and three siblings.

José works in construction, a trade he learned with one of his siblings. He has been working independently for the last five years. His schedule is from 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM and whenever he can, he also grows vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes, chili peppers, etc. as this is another way to generate financial income for him and his family.

This loan will help José to buy a roll of insect-protectant mesh and fertilizers, and to repair a drip-irrigation system for vegetable sowing.

He dreams of continuing his studies with a civil engineering degree, building his own house, and starting a family.

loans.use: to buy a roll of insect-protectant mesh and fertilizers, and to repair a drip-irrigation system for vegetable sowing.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is widow woman from Marneuli district and lives with her father-in-law, who is a teacher and earns 350 GEL monthly. In spite of her professional education, Karina was unable to start any stable job and become financially independent. So she decided to develop a business to earn income for her family's well-being. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor like Karina to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. She will renovate a place that the family owns locally and will rent it out for car services.

Karina will earn a stable source of monthly income and will tackle her financial difficulties. She also will help her father-in-law to cover everyday costs. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased, thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to renovate a family-owed place and rent it for car service.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 61-year-old pensioner woman, from village Algeti. She has a husband, son, daughter-in-law and pensioner mother-in-law. The family lives under poverty as having no source of income except pensions. Svetlana wants to start agricultural activity as it is the profitable activity in the region, but they don't have any financial resources to start it. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Her loan request was approved by a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Svetlana will purchase a cow and will start production of cheese and yogurt. Svetlana and her family members will sell it at the open market and generate some income. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family's living condition will increase and they will have a source of income.

loans.use: to start an agribusiness and purchase a cow.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en: Tukur is a Babban Gona farmer from Tunkuna Vilage. Tukur joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Tukur will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Tukur would like to use his extra earnings to move to the City with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Rukhia

texts.en:
Rukhia, who is 36 years old, lives in the village of Karataklia. She has a husband and both family members are involved in cattle breeding. They get 400 GEL approximately from agricultural activity; that is hardly enough to meet all family expenses. Rukhia wants to increase her family's living condition and earn a stable source of income.

Rukhia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Rukhia requested a loan from Credo to purchase a mini-bus, and was approved within the start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural people to start or re-start businesses.

Rukhia's husband will start work as a driver and get private orders of transportation. The family will get a significant source of income and live in a better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for a private transportation business.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is from the village Nasaguri. She lives with her husband and both get age pension from local government, but that is the only income for the family. The couple lives under poverty as they find it hard to meet even basic needs of the family, and require financial support to make a stable source of income. Tsiala requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting agricultural business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.

Tsiala requested a loan from Credo to start dairy farming. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Tsiala will purchase cattle, breed and after 12 month will start milking. She will sell cheese and yogurt at the local market and generate income in order to cover the family expenses.

Tsiala and her husband will be very thankful for the support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start dairy farming

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, age 39, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with three kids, and her husband is a driver. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Rosalie keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.  She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain the business and beat the competition.  
	
Rosalie has reached her 4th year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy assorted goods for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there  she could afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is from Poblacion, Sindangan. She is earning a living in her small grocery store business, supporting her husband who provides income for their family. 

To generate more income, she decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales. 

Melinda smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Retailing helped Conchita provide for the family. She has a store that sells various food commodities and grocery items. Conchita also engages in tuba (coconut wine) vending for additional earnings. She found the retailing business easy and simple because all she needed to do is to display and tend her store for her buyers. 

Conchita plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the required capital. She wants to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional containers of tuba for retail. 

Conchita smiles at the prospect of earning more profit and being able to save for the repair and expansion of her house.

loans.use: to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional containers of tuba for retail.

location.town: Sindangan-Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 51 years old, married, and has a snack-vending business in Piao, Sindangan. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 4,000 per month. 

Recently, Cecilia availed a loan to purchase marine plywood for walling and roof sheets. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood for walling and roof sheets.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is married and has three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Langub, Guipos. 

Adelina is a farmer who grows flower and vegetable crops to earn a living int her own back yard. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. Adelina has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Adelina hopes to harvest more flower and vegetable crops to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rafael Jesus

texts.es:
Rafael es un joven hombre de 18 años, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial.
Él es inteligente, feliz, soñador, optimista, emprendedor, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad católica que cuenta con una unidad central y tres unidades regionales además de unidades académicas campesinas en zonas rurales, situada al sur de la ciudad. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-19 grados centígrados.
Rafael es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello negro cortado al ras, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que trabaja y con su hermana que estudia en la escuela. viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial y se encuentra en primer año de cinco años que dura la carrera, se prepara para; trabajar en base al mercado y utilizar herramientas de comercialización para generar nuevos emprendimientos basados en oportunidades de mercado e innovación, “mi carrera es una disciplina con un gran campo de acción, por lo que cuento con grandes oportunidades en el mercado laboral…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es que el mercado demanda profesionales en este campo, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar las cuotas de la universidad. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para obtener su título y ejercer su profesión, él desea pagar las cuotas de la universidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Rafael solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de la universidad, terminar su carrera profesional, obtener su título y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Rafael is a young 18-year old man who study Commercial Engineering. He is single and does not have children. He is smart, happy, optimistic, an entrepreneur and a dreamer, responsible and very hard-working. He attends classes at the Catholic University, which has a main campus and 3 regional ones, as well as other centers in rural areas in the South of the city. The weather is cold and dry with temperatures that vary between 1 and 19ºC. 

Rafael has dark skin, brown eyes and black short hair. He is short and thin, and his mother tongue is the Aymará that he uses with his family. He speaks Spanish for general culture and at university. He shares his life with his mother, who works, and his sister, who is in school. He lives in his own house, made of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron ceiling and wooden floor. He has drinking water, electric power and sewage system. 

He is on his first of five years of Commercial Engineering. He wants to be prepared for the market and to use commercial tools to create new businesses based on market and innovation opportunities. "My degree has a broad range of career options, so I will have good opportunities in the job market", he says. The market is demanding professionals in his field, which is an advantage; however, he lacks the money to cover tuition. His dream is to finish his degree, obtain his title and start working, and he wants to pay for university. This is his first loan with the institution. 

Rafael is requesting a loan to cover tuition expenses, finish his degree, obtain his title and start working.

loans.use: to cover tuition expenses, finish his degree, obtain his title and start working.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 41, is married and lives in Sindangan. From her desire to help her family, she engages in dried fish vending. She started with capital of 4,000 PHP and has operated for eight years already. 

Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 30,000 as additional working capital for her existing business from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2011. The loan is intended to purchase more inventory of dried fish that she can supply to her buyers. Someday, Marissa wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. 

She deeply wishes to expand and renovate her house, and live comfortably with her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of dried fish.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
In 2011, Elizabeth learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. Elizabeth tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Elizabeth borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Elizabeth looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Deysi Lisseth

texts.es:
Lisseth, de 43 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, que son su fuente de inspiración por los que lucha diariamente para sacarlos adelante.

Lisseth, tiene 3 años de vender prendas de vestir femeninas, ella sale a las calles todos los días a ofrecer sus productos y tiene su clientela en los diferentes lugares urbanos y rurales del  pueblo. 

Lisseth, necesita le crédito para comprar más prendas de vestir de femeninas, porque quiere aprovechar que estamos en el mes de las madres en nuestro país y la venta de ropa es muy buena en este mes.

Lisseth, sueña con colocar un local fijo de venta de ropa para señoritas, para incrementar sus ganancias y lograr uno de sus sueños mas ansiados.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a 43-year old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children, who are her source of inspiration and the reason she fights every day to get ahead. She has been selling women clothes for 3 years. She sells in the street daily and has clients in different urban and rural areas. 

Lisseth needs the loan to buy more clothes. It is the month of the mothers in our country, and she wants to make the most of it while clothes have good sales. 

Lisseth's dream is to have a fixed store with clothes for women. This way she would increase her income and accomplish one of her biggest dreams.

loans.use: to buy more women clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 48, is happy tending her little store. 

She is married and has three children, and her husband is a farmer. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. 

Josephine keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Josephine believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Josephine has reached her fourth year of membership in Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested," she said.  

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and, from there, afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to re-stock basic commodities.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel has a coconut farm in Sapang Dalaga, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. 

To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Liezel makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for fertilizer and land preparation for planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. 

Liezel wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years old and lives in Langub, Calamba. She is the breadwinner for the family and a mother of an infant. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. 

This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and developing their back yard for a flower garden. In need of additional working capital, Agnes joined Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to buy seedlings and fertilizers. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is hardworking father of two children and a good husband. He is very happy because his pig raising is improving, the same as his flower business.  

Fernando applied for another loan amounting to 7,000 PHP, which he used to buy fertilizer for his flower garden. He plans to pay the term of his loan in six months, so that he can avail another loan from Paglaum Cooperative.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr: Kadiatou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, s’accroupissant dans les habilles bleus, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Ticko au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Kadiatou, âgée de 39 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 8 à 19 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Kadiatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 32 ans. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Kadiatou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Kadiatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 28 ans que Kadiatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Kadiatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures. Enfin Kadiatou espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kadiatou, who is in the first row on the right in the photo, sitting on her heels, wearing blue clothing, is a member of a group of eight farmers registered in myAgro, living and working in the village of Ticko in the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Aged 39, Kadiatou is the mother of six children aged 8 to 19, of whom five are presently in school. 

Family tradition is anchored in agriculture, the principal source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the household, but agriculture also permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family and this has motivated Kadiatou to work in this field for 32 years now. She grows peanuts on her plot of land but like all farmers she has to face difficulties such as lack of rain, of farming supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer. 

Kadiatou is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the system of payment and the training in agricultural techniques as well as in the hope of expanding her yield through the services myAgro offers. This year Kadiatou is making her payments to buy a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase her yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectare. 

Kadiatou has been growing peanuts for 28 years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining that peanuts are directly edible for the family and are used as a basic sauce in cooking. She also grows them because they can be sold profitably at the market. With the increase in her yield and her income, Kadiatou plans to diversify her crops. Finally, she also hopes to be able to build a house for her family and pay for the weddings of her children.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts in order to increase agricultural productivity on her plot of land

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 33-year-old married man from Dier El-Balah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a small house. Muhammad works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions but his income is barely covering all the family's needs.

Muhammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for his house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity.

Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Atiyeh

texts.en:
Atiyeh is a 38-year-old married man from Dier El Balah. He lives with his wife. Atiyeh has a barber shop in the city where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Atiyeh would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Atiyeh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will decrease the electricity expenses.

Atiyeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Khalel

texts.en:
Khalel is 27 years old; he lives in a camp at Nablus. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni and many other items in his grocery store like cleaning materials for the home. He started this business eight years ago; at first he got help from his father with a small amount of capital.

Khalel is requesting this youth loan to supply his grocery with more stock. This will allow him to be able to increase his income and vary his stock, which will attract more customers. That will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

Khalel is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to supply his grocery with more stock like cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni and many other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To provide quality education to help the children fulfil their destinies using the ZEduPad,a modern education tablet designed for primary school children.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and one kid in a small, simple house. Jameel works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Jameel would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Jameel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy an electrical energy generator for the family house, since electricity is not available all day in the Gaza Strip, so having a generator is a necessity.

Jameel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an electrical energy generator for his family's house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electrical energy generator for his family's house.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Arif, one of Ruma’s agents. Arif is a young man who lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. 

Arif owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology, as well as give more contribution to his community. Although he is still young, but he is a hardworking person. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile airtime credits provider. 

As the business grows, Arif needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. 

Arif's goal in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Arif is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Asep, one of Ruma’s agents. Asep lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. He is happily married. Together with his wife, he has one cute son. 

Asep owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. 

As the business grows, Asep is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Asep improve his business, and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.  

Asep's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma's latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Asep is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Redi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Redi, one of Ruma’s agents. Redi is a young man who lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) south of the national capital, Jakarta. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to it by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology, as well as to contribute more to his community. Redi is a cheerful person and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile airtime credits and bill payment services provider. 

As the business grows, Redi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. As seen in the photo, Redi is the one who is standing. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community a better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Didah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Didah, one of Ruma’s agents. Didah lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. She is happily married. Didah sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She already joined Ruma for a year, and she knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her house. 

As the business grows, Didah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Didah improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Didah's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce service for her community with Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Didah is the one who is sitting. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Abdel Shafi

texts.en:
Abdel Shafi is a 22-year-old, single man from Gaza. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Abdel would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy an electrical energy generator for the family house. Since electricity is not available all the day in Gaza Strip, having a generator is a necessity.

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an electrical energy generator for his family's house.

loans.name: Junior Esteban

texts.es: Los habitantes del centro en el municipio de Tubará, día a día tienen la oportunidad de acceder a los servicios que ofrece Junior en su Café Internet.   Esta idea de negocio inició por el consejo de un amigo quien le sugirió apertura este negocio puesto que no  existía alguno en el sector.  Los servicios son ofrecidos todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. a 9 p.m. un horario flexible para todo tipo de público y que pueden acceder a navegación ilimitada, llamadas y recargas a celular, servicio de fotocopiado y transcripción.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, que invertirá en una nueva fotocopiadora.  Esta inversión beneficiará el servicio y con ello la afluencia de clientes.  Junior es padre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes desea ofrecerles calidad de vida, por eso su meta familiar es comprar una vivienda.  Su meta en el negocio es ir a la vanguardia de la tecnología, por eso se preocupa en ir accediendo poco a poco a nuevos equipos.
texts.en:
The inhabitants of the municipality of Tubará have the opportunity to use the services offered by Junior every day at his internet café. This business idea emerged when a friend suggested him to open such a business, since there was nothing like it in the area. The establishment is open every day, from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm, which is a convenient opening time for all kinds of people, who can have unlimited internet access, and can call, recharge their mobile phones, and copy and create documents.

He is currently requesting his first CrediKiva, which he will use to buy a new photocopier. This investment will be beneficial for his business and will help him to attract more customers.

Junior is the father of two underage children and wants to offer them a better quality of life. This is why his goal is to buy a house for his family. Regarding his business, his goal is to have cutting-edge technology. This is why he looks for ways to purchase new equipment, little by little.

loans.use: to buy a new photocopier.

loans.name: Didik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Didik, one of Ruma’s agents. Didik lives in Semarang, capital of Central Java, a nine hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have two children, one daughter and one son. 

Didik owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology. Didik is a friendly and cheerful person and his community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Didik is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Didik improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Didik's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Didik is the one who is sitting. He thanks you for your kind support.
