loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yeni, one of Ruma’s agents. Yeni lives in Semarang, capital of Central Java,  a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, they have one cute son. 

Yeni owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for his community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her house.

As the business grows, Yeni is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more  mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yeni improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.  

Yeni's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so her community can have better access to better products with lower prices. 

Yeni is the who is seen in the photo; she thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments  for members of her local community.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tri, one of Ruma’s agents. Tri lives in Semarang, capital of Central Java, a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Tri is happily married. Together with her husband, they have two sons. 

Tri owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her stall. 

As the business grows, Tri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment services to her community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Tri as she improves her business and accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services. 

Tri is the one who is seen in the photo and she thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of her local community.

loans.name: Aat

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Aat, one of Ruma’s agents. Aat lives in Lebak, a regency located at Banten province, about an hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married, and together with her husband, she has two daughters. 

Aat sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for her community. She already joined Ruma for a year, and she knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she realized that her community really needs access to such services, and she wanted to learn how to start a business, as well. Aat is a kind and friendly person, and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile services provider. 

As the business grows, Aat is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment services to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Aat improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Aat is the one who is smiling. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of her local community.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Virginia wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 51 years old and widowed. She lives in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She cultivates her soil to earn a living.

Dionisia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela always has an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated her farmland in Ozamiz City and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. Adela knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Adela hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita has mastered her transportation business, which has been going for five years. Recently, she requested a loan to pay for motorcycle maintenance and licenses. Lolita hopes to expand her business by adding new motor units for added income.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and licenses

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and married. She is residing at Mabini in the Philippines. To make a living, she buys and sells assorted products. She joined PMPC on January 17, 2010, in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. 

Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of assorted products to sell in the local community. She is focusing on selling fertilizers, ornamentals and vegetables for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy a variety of assorted products

loans.name: Narzabal

texts.en:
Narzabal is from Sindangan, in the Philippines. He is 55 years old and is married. Narzabal owns and manages a retail store business, operating a retail store selling used clothing in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns a good income each month, enabling him to provide the needs of his family. 

In 2012, Narzabal joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid his previous loans from PMPC. 

Narzabal wants to expand his resources, he decided to also sell used shoes, sandals and bags, for which he is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the additional inventory of various used items to sell. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of various used items to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is from Ozamiz City. She earns a living doing her farming activities. 

Recently, Rosela availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. 

Rosela deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 51 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults. Cherry has been engaged in managing her sari-sari store, hot cake making and a coconut buy-and-sell business for 25 years already. She is also engaged in agri-business, specifically mango production, and earns approximately PHP 30,000 each month. She helps her husband in providing for their family's needs.

Cherry has requested a loan to used to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for her sari-sari store business. Cherry has been a member of PMPC for almost four years.

In the future, Cherry hopes plans to acquire a commercial lot near the school areas and establish it with a refreshment and sari sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Entu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Entu, one of Ruma’s agents. Entu lives in Cirebon, a port city on the north coast of the Indonesian island of Java. It is located in the province of West Java, near the provincial border with Central Java and approximately 297 km east of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and he and his wife have two children. Entu works as a government employee. Right now, he also sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma almost a year ago and he knew Ruma from a sales executive that came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to become an entrepreneur, as well as contribute more to his community. Entu is a hard-working person. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Entu is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. This is important to him and your loan will be very useful to help Entu improves his business and his community, who needs access to such services. Entu's goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Entu is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: José Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio, de 43 años de edad, es un hombre campesino dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, está acompañado y vive con sus 4 hijos y su pareja, es muy reconocido en su pueblo por su laboriosidad.

Cecilio, tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en la siembra de granos básicos, dedicándose a la agricultura por herencia de sus padres, que le dejaron un legado especial que es su fuente de sobre vivencia.

Cecilio, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla mejorada y pesticidas   para que la siembra tenga una productividad abundante. 

Cecilio, sueña en el futuro transmitir el legado a sus hijos, para que ellos tengan un pilar importante en su vida y cuiden el patrimonio de la familia, sobre la actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
43-year-old Cecilio is a countryman who works in agriculture. He is in a relationship and lives with his four children and his partner. He is well-known locally for being a hardworking person.

Cecilio has grown basic grains for more than twenty-five years. He inherited this activity from his parents, who left him a special legacy. This is how he makes a living.

Cecilio needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as improved seeds and pesticides, so that his crops can have a great productivity.

Cecilio dreams of leaving this legacy to his children so that they can have important foundations for their lives and take care of the family’s agricultural assets.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as improved seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tri, one of Ruma’s agents. Tri lives in Semarang, the capital of Central Java, 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married, and she and her husband have two children, one daughter and one son. Tri owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew Ruma from a sales executive that came to her stall. 

As the business grows, Tri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. This is important to her and your loan will be very useful to help Tri improve her business and her community, who need access to such services.  Tri's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, which is part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Tri is the one who is sittng in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 27 years old with one child, age 2. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Angeline and her husband operate their sari-sari store (small grocery store) to help out in their everyday expenses.

Angeline has been a SEED partner for some years, and the loans have been used to sustain and improve her business since then. 

Today, Angeline's sari-sari store has more stock and more buyers, as her customers find most of their needs at her store. She also bought a single motorcycle and she plans to build a customized compartment to be used as a public vehicle known as a tricycle. 

Angeline wants to expand her store, but her challenge is the capital. Angeline is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy 3 kilos of sugar, one sack of rice, one box of coffee, one box of noodles and other grocery items to sell in her store.

Angeline's goal someday is to become a wholesaler in their community, as it can increase her income and provide more for her family.

loans.use: to buy for 3 kilos of sugar, one sack of rice, one box of coffee, one box of noodles and other grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Las Concentidas Group

texts.es:
Fabia es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 9 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, localizado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todos los rincones del país, se apropiaron de la zona formando un comercio constante, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Fabia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro lo usa corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (parada al centro, viste blusa rosada). Su vida la disfruta con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; mantenimiento de refrigeradores, venta de comida, venta de horneados, venta de leche, confección de sábanas, venta de embutidos, venta de pollo y venta de accesorios de teléfono, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano, como; zapatos, zapatillas, botas, de temporada, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de zapatos para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir una tienda en un mercado. “ofertando mayor cantidad y variedad mejoraré mis ingresos y podré abrir una tienda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los zapatos se venden continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para abrir una tienda. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el mercado, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fabia solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos de segunda mano por mayor para abrir una tienda de zapatos de segunda mano.
texts.en:
Fabia is a 45-year-old woman who is married and has three children who are 6, 9 and 18 years old. Her business is used shoe sales. She is a good mother, who is enterprising, patient, tenacious, responsible and very hard-working. She sells her shoes in the "Plan 3000" zone, characterized by the multiculturalism of its inhabitants; Aymarás, Quechuas and Guaraníes - migrants from all corners of the country. They appropriated the area and created a trading zone. It is in the southern part of the city and it has a warm sub-tropical climate with temperatures that range between 21 and 35 degrees Cellcius [70 - 95 F] during the day.

Fabia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, black hair that she wears short, and is short and stout in stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, but she uses Spanish in general and for her business (standing in the middle, wearing a pink blouse). She enjoys her life with her husband who works as an employee, and with her children who attend school. They live in their own room which is built of brick and cement and has potable water, electricity and sewerage. 

The need to improve her business led her to form a bank with a group of people to ask for loans to grow their businesses. They have businesses such as: refrigerator maintenance; food sales; baked goods sales; milk sales; sheet-making; sausage sales; chicken sales; and telephone accessory sales. Fabia's business is the sale of used footwear such as shoes, slippers, boots, seasonal footwear, etc. She needs to supply her business with a greater variety and quantity of footwear to compete in the market. She also wants to open a store in a market. "Offering greater quantity and variety will improve my income and allow me to open a store..." she states. The advantage of her business is that shoes are sold all year round, but the disadvantage is her lack of capital to invest in opening a store.

Her dream is is to open a store in the market and she wants to invest in her business by buying used shoes at wholesale.  This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the seven years she has been developing this business. This is why Fabia is asking for a loan - to buy used shoes at wholesale and open a used-shoe store.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to open a used-shoe store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has been preparing carefully for the post-harvest operations of her banana crop in Ozamiz City. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan.

Cecilia hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations for her banana crop.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora de 57 años de edad, no logró obtener ningún grado de estudio ya que en tiempos lo que más le importaba a su familia era el trabajo, ha sido madre soltera de 5 hijos pero solo una hija vive con ella y también 8 nietos que van a la escuela. 

Dora se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a las labores agrícolas,  además le gusta criar cerdos para venderlos después a buen precio en el mercado, y de esta forma es como  lucha para salir adelante.

Ella solicita este crédito para pagar arrendamiento de un terreno, comprar semillas, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la siembra.

Ella sueña con tener fuerzas para seguir trabajando y le gustaría ampliar su granja de cerdos.
texts.en: Dora is 57 years old and she did not study as in those times it was more important for her family to work. She is the single mother of five children but only one daughter lives with her and 8 grandchildren who go to school. Dora does the housework and also farms. She also likes to raise pigs and sell them later at the market at a good price. This is how she struggles to get ahead. She is requesting a loan  to pay the lease on a plot of land, buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor to plant. She dreams of having the strength to continue to work and she would like to expand her pig farm.

loans.use: to pay rent on land, buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labor to plant.

loans.name: Teodicia

texts.en: Teodicia is from the Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old and is married. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for several years. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teodicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital for her sari-sari store business. She wants to buy canned goods, soap, milk and sugar to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 49 años de edad, trabaja haciendo actividades agrícolas, está acompañado, vive con sus 4 hijos y su pareja.

Guadalupe, tiene muchos años preparando la tierra para sembrar granos básicos, siendo un comerciante reconocido por darle precios muy cómodos a sus clientes, ya que su filosofía es satisfacer las necesidades de las personas que hacen posible su desarrollo familiar.

Guadalupe, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y comprar un granero para resguardar la producción de este año.

Guadalupe, sueña con sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para dedicarse a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 49 years old. He works in agriculture. He is in a relationship and lives with his 4 children and his wife.

Guadalupe has many years experience working the earth planting basic grains. He is a merchant known for his very accommodating pricing for his customers as his philosophy is to satisfy the needs of the people who make the family's development possible.

Guadalupe needs a loan to to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides and to buy a granary to store this year's production. Guadalupe dreams of planting 14,000 square meters of land and work selling basic food products in his community.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides and to buy a granary.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en: Alita is 56 years old, married and works hard to help her husband. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling herbal medicine and food vending. Alita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to  purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, de 35 años de edad, realiza  actividades agrícolas,está acompañado y vive con su pareja y sus 5 hijos, también ayuda económicamente a sus padres, porque ellos adolecen de una enfermedad crónica

Mario, tiene varios años trabajando en la siembra de granos básicos, siendo un comerciante reconocido por sacar adelante a su familia, se ha convertido en uno de los comerciantes más solicitado por su carisma y amabilidad hacia las demás personas. 

Mario, está solicitando el crédito para comprar comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, para que la cosecha de una buena producción este año, es por eso que necesita  cuidar sus cultivos, para evitar que la maleza dañe sus granos básicos.

Mario, sueña con comprar un molino y tener una fuente de ingresos adicional.
texts.en: Mario is 35 years old. He is a farmer. He is in a relationship and lives with his wife and five children. He also helps his parents economically as they suffer from a chronic illness. Mario has been growing basic grains for a number of years being known as a businessman who gets his family ahead. He has become one of the most sought after sellers due to his charisma and friendliness toward others. Mario is requesting a loan to buy manure, pesticide and herbicide so that he has good production with his harvest this year. So he needs to care for his crops to avoid infestations damaging his basic grains. Mario dreams of buying a mill and having an additional source of revenue.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Ma'rifat

texts.ru: Маърифат 29 летняя замужняя женщина.  Она на районе проживает с тестю, свекровью, мужем и детьми. Маърифат 3 года предоставляет услуги портнихи. Ей нравится шить женскую одежду, она с раннего детства наблюдала, как ее мама шьет и кроит национальные платья. Маърифат пошла по стопам мамы и тоже стала мастерицей своего дела. Она много времени посвящает своей работе и пополняет семейных бюджет за счет услуги швеи. Для хозяйство, и других нужных продуктов Маърифат тратят из семейного бюджета. Она покупает продукты питания раз в месяц. Они не успевают, употребляет все продукты, потому что они быстро портятся из-за отсутствия холодильника. Маърифат просит кредит для покупки холодильника, чтобы их продукты сохранялись дольше.
texts.en:
Ma'rifat is 29 and married and lives in the region with her husband, his parents and her children. She has been working as a seamstress for three years. She likes sewing women's clothing - from a young age she watched her mother sewing and tailoring traditional dresses, and she has followed in her mother's footsteps and also become a skilled tradesperson. She dedicates a lot of time to her work and fills out the family budget with her earnings from sewing so she can purchase necessary groceries and other household needs. 

Ma'rifat buys groceries once per month, but they don't succeed in using everything because they go bad quickly since the family doesn't have a refrigerator. She is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge so that her groceries will keep for longer.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en: Milyn makes a living through her snack vending business. She runs her business in Canlambo, Siquiijor and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with PMPC to gain access to working capital. She wants to increase her inventory and avail of a loan to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. Milyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Baby Lou

texts.en: Kym Patrick is 18 years old and is the third of thirteen children in the family. His mother, Baby Lou, is a member of the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Kiva's partner. Baby Lou supports the family through her retail frozen products business in the Philippines. Kym Patrick is studying for a bachelor of science degree in radiology technology and is currently in the second of this four-year course. Baby Lou is borrowing 10,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for her son for the first semester of the 2015-2016 school year. When he graduates, Kym Patrick plans to help his parents send his brothers and sisters to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en: Edlyn is 36 years old, married and has three children who are in school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has done for 14 years. Edlyn requested a 29,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy feed and other farm supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Edlyn would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other farm supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ana Concepción

texts.es:
Ana de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con él ha procreado 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y están casados, en su casa solamente viven su esposo y ella.

Ana se dedica  a los oficios domésticos desde que era pequeña, su madre le enseñó  este oficio, además apoya a su esposo en la agricultura pues gracias a las siembras y la semilla cosechada ellos pueden obtener ingresos económicos y así poder tener lo necesario en su casa.

Este préstamo le servirá a Ana para comprar  4 sacos de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, preparar la tierra y pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz. 

Ella planea para un futuro tener una tienda con productos de la canasta básica para así poder ayudar a su esposo económicamente.
texts.en: Ana is 44 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has 3 children who are adults and married. Only her husband and her live in their house. Ana has worked doing domestic work since she was young. Her mother taught her this work. And she also helps her husband with the agriculture. Thanks to their planting and the harvested crops they can obtain economic income and be able to have what is needed in their household. Ana will use this loan to buy four bags of manure, insecticide and fertilizer to prepare the land and pay for labor to plant corn. In the future she plans to have a store with basic food items to be able to help her husband economically.

loans.use: to buy four bags of manure, insecticide and fertilizer to prepare the land and pay for labor to plant corn.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 46 years old and has fourteen children. She is married and five of her children are in school.

Analiza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analiza has been in this business for 6 years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta has a rice mill business and sells rice, and she buys "palay" (grains) for this. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a good income every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for tons of palay grains and the maintenance of her rice mill. She dreams of owning a hauling truck to easily transport her rice and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for tons of palay grains and maintenance of her rice mill.

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Vanessa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vanessa, de 24 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y comerciante de suplementos alimenticios y ropa femenina, está soltera y vive junto a sus padres, pero es independiente económicamente.

Vanessa, tiene un par de años trabajando como vendedora independiente y asegura que le ha ido muy bien en las ventas.

Vanessa, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y más suplementos alimenticios, para hacer crecer su inventario y atraer más clientes. 

Vanessa, desea seguir con su negocio y continuar sus estudios superiores universitarios.
texts.en:
Vanessa, age 24, is an enterprising young woman.  She sells dietary supplements and women’s clothes.  She is single, and she lives with her parents.  However, she is financially independent.

Vanessa has been working as an independent salesperson for a couple of years.  She declares that sales have been going very well for her.

Vanessa needs the loan to buy more clothes and more dietary supplements in order to make her inventory grow and to attract more customers.

Vanessa wishes to continue with her business and to continue with her university studies.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and more dietary supplements in order to make her inventory grow and to attract more customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 30-year-old woman who has three children, two of whom are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cristina has been in this business for one year now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 53 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

Ailyn has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Adoracion has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marvin Edilberto

texts.es:
Marvin de 24 años de edad, es un Joven muy trabajador que  actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la universidad primer año de Administración de Empresas, está casado y su esposa también estudia, aún no tiene hijos por lo tanto solo su esposa depende de él.

Marvin se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de hortalizas como lo es chile, plátano, güisquil, tomate, pipián y también maíz y frijol, desde que era pequeño su padre le enseñó a realizar esta labor la cual ahora le ha servido de mucho pues es su principal fuente de ingresos para salir adelante en los estudios con su esposa.


Él solicita este crédito para comprar semillas, 3 sacos de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, preparar la tierra y pagar la mano de obra, también comprará un tanque de fibra de vidrio para almacenar agua.

Él planea construir su propia casa para poder estar cómodamente con su esposa, terminar sus estudios y procrear hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin, age 24, is a very hard-working young man.  He is in his first year of studying business administration at the university.  He is married, and his wife is also going to school.  They do not have children yet, so only his wife is dependent upon him.

Marvin devotes himself to agriculture.  He grows produce like chili peppers, bananas, squash, tomatoes, pumpkins, and also corn and beans.  When he was little, his father taught him how to do this work.  This has now served him well.  It is his main source of income in order to get ahead in his studies and with his wife.

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, three sacks of compost, insecticides, and fertilizers.  He will also use the loan to prepare the land and to pay for the labor.  He will also buy a fiberglass tank to store water.

He plans to build his own house in order to be able to live comfortably with his wife, complete his education, and to have children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, to prepare the land, to pay for labor, and to buy a fiberglass tank to store water.

loans.name: Jun Maricar

texts.en:
Jun Maricar is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jun Maricar has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials needed for her business, like spare parts and other maintenance items.

Jun Maricar has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business, like spare parts and other maintenance items.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee, de 56 años de edad, es un señora muy conocida en su comunidad por su trabajo y dedicación, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, una de sus hijas esta a punto de graduarse de enfermera, ella esta orgullosa de sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Haydee, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, ella sale a las comunidades y a los pueblos, para ofrecer sus productos.

Haydee, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para su negocio.

Ella, desea seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que se gradúen y sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Haydee, 56, is a woman who is very well known in her community for her hard work and dedication.  She is a single mother with 3 children.  One of her daughters is about to graduate with a nursing degree, and Haydee is very proud that she is able to help her children to get ahead.

Haydee has a business selling clothing for men, women, and children.  She goes out to the communities and towns to offer her products for sale.

Haydee needs a loan to buy more clothing for her business.  She wants to continue to work so that she can continue to help her children.  This way, they can graduate and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 61 years old and is married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Fely has been farming sugarcane for 5 years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and frozen foods. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vista Al Mar - Pachacutec Group

texts.es: Julia es una mujer luchadora, casada y madre de 2 hijos, uno de 21 y el otro de 13 años que todavia se encuentra en edad escolar,Julia tiene un negocio de abarrotes donde trabaja 8 horas diarias desde hace un año que pudo comprar su puesto en un mercado cercano a su casa,donde sus principales clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos,el cual se siente muy contenta de poder atenderlos,Julia pertenece al grupo Vista al mar de Pachactec donde una de sus vecinas la invito para formar este grupo donde las socias son muy unidas y responsables.Julia se siente muy feliz de poder contar con el prestamos que Edaprospo le brinda y la tasa de interes baja que Kiva les ofrece,ya que asi va a poder implementar su negocio en la compra de abarrotes como leche,azucar,aceite,huevo y demas.Julia dice "Gracias Kiva, por la ayuda brindada que das a gente como nosotros que salimos adelante por el bienestar de nuestras familias.sabremos aprovechar al maximo la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Julia is a tenacious woman who is married and is the mother of 2 children.  One of her children is 21, and the other is 13 years old and is in school.  Julia has a grocery store business where she works 8 hours a day.  A year ago, she was able to buy a stall in a market close to her home. Her customers are mostly her neighbors and friends who live nearby, and she feels very content to be able to serve them. 

Julia belongs to the communal bank "Vista al Mar de Pachactec."  One of her neighbors invited her to join this group, where the members are very united and responsible.  Julia feels very happy to be able to rely on loans provided by Edaprospo at the low interest rate that Kiva offers, because this way she can stock up her grocery store business with items such as milk, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, and other items.

Julia says "Thank you Kiva, for the help you are providing that gives people like us the ability to get ahead with our families and provide for their well-being.  We will take advantage of this assistance to the maximum extent possible."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Bebenia

texts.en:
Bebenia is 52 years old and married, with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Bebena runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and drinks.

Bebenia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from an e-loading station.

Bebenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and drinks.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 43 years old, married, and has six children (three of whom are in school). She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Liberty requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy food, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 1 year, and she has borrowed from MWTF 4 times in the past to sustain it. In the future, Liberty would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 30 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc.

Belinda has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF in the past. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from food vending, raising pigs, and E-Loading.

Belinda aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru: Этого счастливого отца и глава семейства зовут Абдуназар. Ему 42 года. Абдуназар отец семерых детей и любимый муж. Абдуназар вместе с семьей живет на районе Шахритус. В этом районе он занимается животноводством. Он настоящий пастух и даже имеет своего коня. Абдуназар начинает свою работу с раннего утра до самого вечера. Он любит свою работу и унаследовал эту деятельность от своих предков. Абдуназар принял решение расширить животноводческую деятельность и принести в дом больше дохода, так как дети растут и растут их расходы. С каждым днем ему становится труднее прокормить семью. Абдуназар планирует на заемные средства приобрести пару голов телят и увеличить поголовья скотин с такими намерениями он обращается за займом.
texts.en:
This happy father and head of the family is called Abdunazar. He is 42 years old. Abdunazar is the father of seven children and a beloved husband. Abdunazar lives with his family in the Shahrituz region. He rears animals in this area. He is a true shepherd and even has his own horse.

Abdunazar starts his work early in the morning and continues until the evening. He loves his work and inherited this activity from his forefathers. Abdunazar has taken the decision to expand his animal rearing business and to bring home more income, since his children are growing and so are their expenses. Each day it becomes harder for him to feed the family. Abdunazar plans to acquire a couple of calves with the borrowed money and to increase the size of his herd, and so with these intentions he is applying for a loan.

loans.use: to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.name: Elenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elenia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling home care products in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from tailoring.  

Elenia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, dishwashing liquid, etc. for her business buying and selling home care products.

Elenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, dishwashing liquid, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Estrella

texts.en:
Ma. Estrella is 65 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Ma. Estrella requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso de 38 años es un experimentado carpintero que se ha destacado por elaborar closet de excelente calidad hechos en madera de diferentes tipos. Cuenta con 20 años de experiencia y en el ejercicio de su labor fue puliendo detalles, colocando su propio estilo y toque personal.  En el año 2013 se independizó y tiene tres empleados para poder cumplir con la producción que envía a Cartagena de Indias y almacenes del centro de Barranquilla.  Sus pedidos son generados cada quince días y cancelados de contado, aunque también ofrece facilidad en sus pagos y para responder a la demanda, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos como madera, pegamento, pinturas, papel para envoltura y demás.  Es padre de cuatro hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar y su meta familiar es comprarles una vivienda.  A futuro desea dotar de maquinaria más especializada y contratar más empleados.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 38, is an experienced carpenter, known for making good-quality wardrobes of many kinds of wood.  He has been a carpenter for 20 years and is a meticulous worker with a unique and personal style.  He opened his own shop in 2013 and has three workers now.  He sends finished products to Cartagena and Barranquilla for sale in those large Colombian cities.  He receives orders every 15 days.  His buyers normally pay in cash, but he does extend credit for sales when required.  
Alfonso is applying to Kiva's partner, Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--wood, glue, pain, packaging, etc.--to carry on his business.  
Alfonso has four young children and his goal for the future is to buy a family house.  He also wants to buy specialized equipment for his business and hire more employees.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
XXX Coffee is a mobile coffee retailer and service provider based in New York with proprietary blends of espresso and coffee. It is owned and overseen by William, who goes by Drew, a man who knows both how to create wonderful coffee blends and how to serve them. He has over 20 years of experience in the coffee industry, and has served as a judge for both the World Barista Championship and the Specialty Coffee Association of America. Almost as soon as he moved to the United States five years ago, he started this small business.

William’s coffee company serves coffee and sells retail products online and via a bicycle cart at Socrates Sculpture Park. He also sells to retail locations throughout New York. 

William is planning to expand the services of his company.  With his loan, he plans to produce a new coffee roast for resale. He will use the money to purchase green beans and other coffee production consumables, and to pay a roaster to roast the blend.

See more information about him and his business at his kickstarter page here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/586909199/xxx-coffee

Or, check out his website at http://xxxcoffee.com/

loans.use: to produce a new coffee roast for sale at his coffeeshop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married with seven children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, de 59 años de edad, es comerciante de aretes y joyas, está soltera y solo vive con su único hijo, su nuera y su nieto.

Guillermina, tiene varios años vendiendo aretes y joyas, ella vende sus prendas casa por casa y en los principales mercados del pueblo, tiene mucha clientela pues es muy reconocida.

Guillermina, necesita el crédito para comprar más aretes, porque le están solicitando aretes de moda, además comprara algunas joyas que tiene como encargo. 

Guillermina, desea en el futuro poner una pequeña joyería en el mercado del pueblo.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 59, makes a living buying and selling jewelry.  She is single and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson.  

Guillermina has operated her business for several years.  She works as a street vendor, going door to door and market to market, selling earrings and other jewelry.  She has many customers who know and like her.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to stock her business with the latest style of earrings and the rest to fill orders that she has already received.

For the future, Guillermina wants to open a jewelry store.

loans.use: to stock her jewelry sales business.

loans.name: Janelle

texts.en:
Janelle began her business Flea Free Organically in 2008. As a former nurse, Janelle decided she wanted to create an organic product to be used in place of these harmful medications. 

She began her organic flea removal business for pets and households when she lost her service dog to a bad reaction from a flea medication. 

Janelle also saw similar side effects on children living around pets that used these medications. Janelle started Flea Free Organically and began selling a variety of products. She began by selling these products at the farmer's markets in North County and online.  

Since that time, she had been operating out of her home in northern San Diego. In 2014, she moved to central San Diego, and has since struggled to keep the exposure and visibility she once had in North County.

She is in the process of reorganizing her business for better exposure and profitability. Janelle is currently selling online and will use the Kiva loan to increase her inventory and advertising, specifically through the production of organic pet treats called Mutter Butter. The loan will help Janelle continue to grow her business and pursue her passion for public health and animals.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and advertise her organic pet products business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture for his home

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 36 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell.

Fely has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from manicure service.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jorry

texts.en:
Jorry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for his buy and sell charcoal business.

Jorry has been in this business for 15 years. Jorry earns more income from farming sugarcane and furniture making.

He successfully repaid his previous loan and now he has requested another loan to further build his businesses. 

Jorry has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 38 years old and single with one child. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and other items.

Ailyn has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs, and other items

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
As a married parent of children, Marisol works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marisol is borrowing 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in the market for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Marisol has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, rice, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is 39 years old with four children.

Purisima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a motorcycle transport in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and do other maintenance.

Purisima has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the motorcycle transport for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Purisima aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do other maintenance on her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 32 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Maria has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell and save money for college

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and married with three children. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Carmen Alexander

texts.es:
Carmen, de 26 años de edad, es un  joven  dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, todo lo que sabe se lo heredo su padre desde muy pequeño, actualmente está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos.

Carmen, tiene varios años sembrando granos básicos, ya que su padre desde pequeño lo llevaba al campo para enseñarle como se debía trabajar, todo eso le permitió obtener experiencia y que hoy en día se convertiría en su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Carmen, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha.

Carmen, sueña con colocar una tienda en su casa, para tener otra fuente de ingresos a parte de la venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 26, is a farmer.  He learned farming from his father as a boy and is an experienced farmer now.  He is married and has 2 children.  His farm is the family's main source of income.  

Carmen is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--fertilizer, herbicides, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will ensure that he maximizes his yield and earns the most that he can from his crop.

For the future, Carmen wants to open a small store that would generate an extra income for the family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Jose Ceferino

texts.es:
José, de 52 años de edad, es un hombre dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, actualmente está acompañado y tiene 5  hijos y él es el encargado de los gastos de la familia.

José, tiene más de 35 años sembrando granos básicos, produce alrededor de 21,000 metros cuadrados de cada cosecha. 

José, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para obtener una buena cosecha y que favorezca su economía familiar.

José, desea que sus hijos crezcan y que tengan conocimientos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Jose, 52, is a farmer.  He is married and has 5 children.  His family depends on his income.

Jose has made a living from farming grain crops for 35 years.  He produces around 21,000 square-meters of grain per harvest.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the farming supplies he needs to maximize his yield and make the most of his next crop.  

For the future, Jose wants his children to learn everything there is to know about farming.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi has been in the retail business for 10 years. She sells clothing in nearby villages and sometimes instead of money she changes clothing for food. This is important so her family has daily food and can support its living.
Armenuhi asks for this loan to purchase new stocks of clothing and home supplies to change for food. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Armenuhi hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her small business activity.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and home supplies for reselling to customers and purchasing food for the family.

loans.name: Glorife

texts.en:
Glorife is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glorife is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Glorife has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Glorife has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: La Familia De Santa Marta Group

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula. Doña María, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a su familia, cultivando café, hortalizas, maíz y frijoles. Esta producción es vendida en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo en forma grupal para la compra de abonos, y pago de limpieza de su finca de café. Su plan es mantener en buen estado la finca para sacar mejor cosecha. A largo plazo tiene pensado comprar mas terreno con cultivo de café. El grupo se llama La Familia de Santa Marta, integrado por tres mujeres que se dedican a la agricultura y se conocen en su comunidad. El préstamo total del grupo es por 40,000 lempiras para abonar, sembrar vivero y limpiar la finca de café. En la foto se identifica doña María a la izquierda, Karen y Sandra a la derecha.
texts.en: Doña Maria, 54 years old, is married, has three children and resides in a community that belongs to the municipality of San Pedro Sula. Doña Maria, has always made a living in agriculture with her family, raising coffee, vegetables, corn, and beans. This produce is sold in the local market. She has decided to apply for a group loan for the purchase of fertilizer, and payment for the cleaning of their farm. Their plan is to maintain the farm in good condition in order to get a better harvest. In the long term they have planned to buy more land with cultivation of coffee. The group is called La Familia de Santa Marta (The Family of Saint Marta), made up of three women who make a living in agriculture and are known in their community. The total group loan is 40,000 lempiras in order to fertilize, plant a nursery,and to clean the coffee farm. In the photo, Doña Maria is on the left, Karen and Sandra are on the right.

loans.use: To purchase of fertilizer and payment of labor for the maintenance of their coffee farm.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 34 años de edad es casada, tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 10 y 17 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y pollo frito, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace cinco años.
Catarina ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro y  block, pues con lo que gana en su pequeño negocio no le alcanza para comprar todo lo necesario, por tal razón solicita un préstamo porque es la única forma de pagar la deuda poco a poco.
Catarina tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder terminar la construcción de su casa y darle a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Catarina, 34, and her husband have two beautiful children: 17- and 10-years old, respectively.  The family lives in the small town of Solola.  She started her own business five years ago, making and selling fried chicken and french fries, to help pay family expenses. 

Catarina is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the building materials she needs--cement, sand, steel bar, etc.--to finish the family house.  Her earnings don't stretch far enough to cover the expense of the building and she is applying for a loan that she can pay off a bit at a time.  The investment will, she says, allow her to finish her house and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the building materials she needs to finish her house.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 62 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits, home care products, eggs, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, biscuits, dried fish, condiments, and other groceries. 

Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, home care products, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old with five children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, beverages, home  care products and other groceries.

Herminia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, junk food, candies, and other groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, beverages, home care product s and other groceries

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda works hard to support her family. Razelda is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

Razelda has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 53 años consideró que debía buscar una forma de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar, ante tal circunstancia decidió ofrecer a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares productos por intermedio de catálogos especializados.  Su hija trabaja en un hospital y tiene muchos conocidos, ella le ayuda a impulsar ventas desde su trabajo.  Elizabeth se dedica a sus labores cotidianas en el hogar y su vida comercial la ejerce en cualquier momento del día cuando tiene un espacio para entregarles la revista de productos a sus clientes.  Ella les ofrece productos de  naturales para el cuidado de la salud, cosméticos y artículos para el hogar.   Actualmente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con el que planea darle impulso a sus ventas y con esta inversión responder a la demanda de sus clientes quienes le han solicitado encargos; medicinas y cremas naturales, artículos para el hogar y demás.  Elizabeth es madre de dos hijas a quienes ayuda con el cuidado de sus nietos y su gran desafío ha sido no poder acceder a créditos en el sector financieros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 53, decided that she had better look for a way of earning some income in order to support her husband with the household expenses.  Accordingly, she decided to offer her neighbors, friends, and family members products from specialty catalogs.  Her daughter works in a hospital and has a lot of acquaintances.  She helps her to drive sales from her work. 

Elizabeth does her daily chores in the home and carries out her business in any free moment during the day when she can find time to deliver a catalog of products to her customers.  She offers them natural products for caring for your health, cosmetics, and articles for the home.

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan, with which she plans to increase her sales.  With this investment she can respond to her customers’ requests; they have been asking for shipments of medicines and natural creams, household products, and other items.  Elizabeth is the mother of two daughters whom she helps out by caring for her grandchildren.  Her biggest challenge has been not being able to access loans from the financial sector.

loans.use: to buy medicines, natural creams, articles for the home, and other items.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Irene has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn lives at Solana with her family. She is 45 years old, and married with three children. Her youngest child is still attending school and needs daily allowances. 

Jocelyn and her spouse manage the farming business since they got married about 20 years ago. Jocelyn also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. 

She wanted to manage her farming business well but had insufficient fund to sustain crops; that is why she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor cost in farming. The farm inputs she will buy will be a great help in sustaining her crops for bountiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor cost in farming

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 35 years old, married, and had four children. Dexter was involved in rice farming as a business. His wife is a housekeeper. Aside from generating income in the business, he also serves his community as Barangay Chairman. He is responsible both to her family and his fellows. 

In his farming business, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He needs continuous sustenance to his rice crop, so he is now borrowing additional capital of P50,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming.  

He hopes to achieve good profits that will help sustain educational needs of his children. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married, 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilou has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs to save for college funds

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 38 years old.

Rosemarie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Glenda works hard to support her family. She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell through her business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 45 years old and widowed.

She runs agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie is borrowing PHP 7500 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melanie has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from E-loading station.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and has seven children. She has one child in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Grace works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell through her business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, diapers, biscuits, condiments, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jescelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jescelle works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Jescelle is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Jescelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Crispina is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Crispina has a manufacturing native bags business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native bags.

Crispina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native bags.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 43 años de edad, es un hombre dedicado a la pesca y a la agricultura, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y sus  2 hijos.

Manuel, tiene mucha experiencia respecto a la siembra de granos básicos, ya que por más de 25 años ha desempeñado esta importante actividad productiva, además se dedica a la pesca desde su infancia.

Manuel, está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, ya que con su experiencia asegura que es importante proteger la tierra para evitar las plagas.

Manuel, desea comercializar sus productos fuera de su comunidad, para atrapar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel, 43 years old, is a man who makes his living from fishing and agriculture. He is in a relationship and lives with his spouse and their 2 children.

Manuel has a lot of experience in sowing basic grains since for more than 25 years he has carried out this important productive activity. Furthermore, he has made a living from fishing since his childhood.

Manuel is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies for his crops since with his experience guarantees that it is important to protect the earth to avoid infestations.

Manuel wishes to sell his products outside of his community to bring in new customers.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Sekou's Group

texts.fr: Sekou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, portant un bonnet vert et tenant une pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Ouoronina au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Sekou, âgé de 49 ans, est le père de 11 enfants âgés de 3 à 28 ans, dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Sekou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 42 ans. Sekou cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et de semences de qualité. Sekou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Sekou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 38 ans que Sekou cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Sekou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Sekou espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants. Il a exprimé que, "Je possède un lot a Bamako et j'aimerais bien construire une maison pour mes enfants car tout ce que je fais, je le fais pour assurer l'avenir de mes enfants."
texts.en:
Sekou, the one in front on the photo, wearing a green cap and holding a myAgrou pouch, belongs to a group of five farmers who have signed up with myAgro.
