They all work and live in the village of Ouoronina to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Sekou, 49 years old, has 11 children ranging from 3 to 28 years of age, 10 of whom are now in school. Traditionally, Sekou’s family engaged in farm work, the main source of revenue and food for the household. Sekou also likes farming and has been doing it for 42 years. Sekou grows corn on his field. His challenges are low rainfall and the lack of farm supplies and quality seeds. 

Sekou is starting his first year with myAgro. He has signed up because of an installment plan offered and the positive opinion of friends and family of myAgro, as well as because of an opportunity for training in agricultural techniques. This year Sekou  is making payments on on a pack of myAgro OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers to grow corn and increase his yield of corn on his field of 0.5 ha [1.2 acres]. Sekou has been growing corn for 38 years as a source of food and also because it is a valuable commodity. With an increase in his yield and his revenues, Sekou plans to enlarge his field. He also hopes to build a house for his family and pay for the weddings of his children. He states that he owns a land plot in Bamako and would like to build a house there for his children since all the work he does is mean to ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to pay for a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Siti Jubaidah

texts.en: Siti Jubaidah is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs and vending fish.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 51 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Liza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as tuba, pancit, vegetables and other groceries. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Diosan

texts.en:
Diosan is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling clothes and vegetables.

Diosan dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Analyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Charlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 30 years old, married and has two children. 

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Jane has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 49 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marites has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman, 61 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Delia has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell like body lotion, perfume, bags, etc.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell like body lotion, perfume, bags, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer agricultura, es madre soltera, vive solo con sus 2 hijos, pero a pesar de ello ha salido adelante.

María, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, principalmente en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol; pero a parte de eso tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla mejorada y pesticidas, para que sus cultivos sean sanos y produzcan una buena cosecha.

María,  desea comprar más productos para su tienda y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, 24 years old, is a farmer. She is a single mother who lives alone with her 2 children, but despite this she has come out ahead.

Maria has 15 years of experience in agriculture, mainly in sowing basic grains like corn and beans. However, apart from this she has a small store in her home.

Maria needs the loan to purchase improved seeds and pesticides so her crops are healthy and produce a good harvest.

Maria wishes to purchase more products for her store and to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old with one child age 13. Her husband is a painter but his wages are not enough for their daily expenses. To help out, Rosemarie started to sell breakfast, spaghetti, pancit (noodles), ham, hot dogs and eggs in front of her house.

Rosemarie has been a partner of SEED since last year and the loan was able to sustain and improve her business. Rosemarie since then has continued to sell her breakfast food and save for her child's education in college.

Rosemarie now wanted to take the opportunity of selling more of her breakfast food to students since her location is in front of the school. She wants to add a table and chairs for those who want to eat on the spot.

Rosemarie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy a table, utensils, ingredients, and groceries to add to her breakfast food stall.

Rosemarie wants to expand her food stall and add more menu items to help provide and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy a table, utensils, ingredients, and groceries to add to her breakfast food stall

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Denia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an E-Loading station. 

Denia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, cooking oil, flour, spices, utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Denia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, cooking oil, flour, spices, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Atiyeh

texts.en:
Atiyeh is a 25-year-old single man from Rafah City. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as a driver in public transportation. Atiyeh would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the necessities.

Atiyeh took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water for the family house without using electricity. Atiyeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Remie

texts.en: Remie, 29 years old, is married with three children. She is living in Larena, Siquijor and has coconut land that was pawned due lack of finances. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. She accessed a loan to pay to redeem her coconut land. Remie is fortunate to become a Paglaum member.

loans.use: To pay for redeeming coconut land

loans.name: Jonilda

texts.en: Jonilda lives in Larena and supports her family by building houses from the ground up. She has applied for a loan which she used to buy building materials and paint and to pay her workers. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paint and pay her workers

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. He earns income by transferring goods using a motorized rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. After one year of work, Mohammad needs to repair his rickshaw and do some maintenance so took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new engine for his rickshaw. This will increase his productivity and also his income
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his motorized rickshaw.

loans.name: Fekri

texts.en:
Fekri is a 31-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He earns income by transferring goods using a motorized rickshaw. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. After one year of work, Fekri needs to repair his rickshaw and do some maintenance so he took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new engine for his rickshaw. This will increase his productivity and also his income
Fekri appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his rickshaw

loans.name: Clarenda

texts.en: Clarenda has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for years. She lives in Larena, Siquijor. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. Recently, she borrowed an amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase merchandise for her ready-to-wear clothing business. Clarenda is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her ready-to-wear clothing business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family. Cecelia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cecelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, cooking oil, flour, and spices, and additional utensils and other materials for her food-vending business.

Cecelia has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, cooking oil, flour, and spices, and additional utensils for her food-vending business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 48 years old and married with five children.  With one child still in school, Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, bread, milk, coffee, etc.

Marjorie has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, bread, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 37 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Nenita requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Helen dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Regina is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Regina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Regina has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Marcelina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a dried fish business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Rosalinda requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 29-year-old hardworking man with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a butcher shop alongside farming that adds more income for him. He is faced with challenges of low turnover of customers, that leads to low profits. However, he is working hard to diversify his business into selling produce that will bring him more profits. 

Christopher has requested a loan to buy meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables to sell from her home.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir is a hardworking man from the city of Kulob. He is 35 years old, and a wonderful father. He has a large family consisting of eight people, and he should provide for his family. Currently, Tohir works in a mill, but unfortunately his income is not enough. His wife is a seamstress, and she had sewed dresses. But at the moment, her sewing machine is broken and Tohir wants to help his wife not to lose a source of income. For this reason, he applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. Tohir believes in you!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 12 y 20 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de juegos pirotécnicos artesanales.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en diferentes ciudades del eje troncal, caracterizado por estar conectadas entre sí mediante carreteras automovilísticas de fácil acceso para el transporte público y privado. El clima del lugar varía de acuerdo a la altura, siendo la temperatura más fría en las alturas alrededor de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Petrona es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijas; la mayor estudia y trabaja y la menor estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de juegos pirotécnicos artesanales; cuyo ingrediente principal es la pólvora, con productos que van desde pequeños petardos hasta grandes fuegos artificiales, “todo lo armamos a mano y para la producción colabora toda la familia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los fuegos artificiales son muy populares en fiestas patronales y grandes acontecimientos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de pólvora por mayor. Su sueño es incrementar su producción para ofertar sus productos a otras ciudades, ella desea realizar la compra de pólvora por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Petrona solicita un préstamo para la compra de pólvora para fabricar materiales pirotécnicos, incrementar su producción y ofertar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Petrona is a 40 year-old single woman with two daughters, ages 12 and 20. Her business is the production of handmade fireworks.

She is a good mother and is enterprising, independent, optimistic, responsible and very hardworking. She conducts her business in different cities in the tri-city hub, which are known for being connected to one another by roadways with easy access to public and private transportation. The climate varies from place to place according to the altitude, with coldest temperatures in elevations around 4000 meters above sea level. 

Petrona has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair that she wears braided, and is short with a medium build. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl and skirt) and her native language is Aymará. She speaks Spanish because of the mainstream culture and in order to do business. 

She shares her life with her daughters; the eldest studies and works and the youngest is in school. They live in their own room constructed of adobe, brick and cement, with a tin roof, a wood floor and drinking water, electricity, gas and sewage. 

Her business is the production of handmade fireworks, whose main ingredient is gunpowder, and the products range from small firecrackers to large fireworks. She says "they are all made by hand with the whole family's collaboration." The advantage of her business is that fireworks are very popular for festivals and big events, and the disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to purchase wholesale gunpowder. 

Her dream is to increase her production in order to offer her products in other cities. She wants to buy wholesale gunpowder. This is her first loan with the institution in 12 years that she has been doing this business independently. It is for these reasons that Petrona is requesting a loan to purchase gunpowder in order to make fireworks materials, increase her production and offer her products to other cities.

loans.use: to purchase gunpowder in order to produce fireworks materials, increase her production and offer her products to other cities.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 48 years old and lives in Camogao, Larena. She invests her time and money in vending snacks and has mastered her recipe for bread. She has many customers from different countries, who pass by in their area.

Lilibeth is also a member in good standing of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. Recently, she borrowed an amount of PHP 12,000 to buy ingredients for making "pan bisaya" (sweet bread) and to acquire additional capital. Lilibeth is thankful for PMPC.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making "pan bisaya" (sweet bread) and to acquire additional capital

loans.name: 030802240001.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Ngân works in agriculture raising livestock. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Ngân is 23 years old, and she is married with two children. Ngân is the group leader of the 030802240001.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Ngân has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Farming is the main source of her income. PMPC came to Norma's rescue and lent her money when she needed it the most.

Now she has availed herself of another loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, herbicides and compost to induce bigger and longer corn ear development and better filled corn kernels.

Norma perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, herbicides and compost to induce bigger and longer corn ear development and better filled corn kernels

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Contribute now for Iluminada. Recently, she was granted a loan amounting PHP 50,000 which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanksgiving, she would like to access another loan worth PHP 50,000. This time, too, she will utilize it to add more products to sell for her direct selling business.  

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help cover the family needs, basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

Illuminada simply prays for good health for the family and to have their house in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional products to sell for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Yenyen

texts.en:
Yenyen works hard to support her family. Yenyen is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Yenyen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Yenyen has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell feeds for animals.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ramona works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a restaurant.  Ramona is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and spices for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business. 

Ramona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, de 29 años de edad, es un  joven pescador y agricultor, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

Luis, tiene varios años sembrando granos básicos, aunque su principal actividad productiva es la pesca y la agricultura le permite complementar los gastos para el sustento de su familia.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para preparar la tierra de plagas y de la maleza, porque se acerca la época para iniciar a sembrar.  

Luis, sueña con comprarle un motor a su balsa, para pescar más y tener mejores posibilidades para poder comercializar pescado en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Luis is 29 years old. He is a young fisherman and farmer. He is single and lives with his parents.

Luis has sowed basic grains for many years, although his main productive activity is fishing. Agriculture allows him to supplement the expenses for the support of his family.

Luis needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to protect the land from infestations and from weeds because the time to begin sowing is nearing.

Luis dreams of purchasing a motor for his raft to fish more and to have better possibilities to be able to sell fish in other places.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to protect the land from infestations and from weeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 which she used to buy an additional 10 sacks of rice and sacks of white and washed sugar to sell in her general store. With business doing well, she was able to pay back her loan on time and increase her income which helps with their daily and school expenses of her four other children.

Marites now is more intent on supplying another store and also being able to employ a helper to help with the delivery of sugar and rice. And because of the opening of the classes, Marites' customers demand for rice has also increased, since rice is the most common food in the Philippines.

Marites is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy more sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, and cooking oils which she sells wholesale or retail to customers in her store. These will help her increase her income still more.

Marites wants to sustain her improving store to help pay for the home she accessed through rent-to-own. She also her children to finish their education.

From general enterprise, Marites is now a Small Enterprise, since her business is not just to help their family with expenses but also a business generating an income and helping the community to gain employment.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, and more cooking oils which she sells wholesale or retail to customers in her store.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is a 28-year-old single man from Khan Younis City. He lives with his family in a small house. He wants to improve himself and be independent so he is thinking of starting to sell cosmetics and accessories. Hisham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business. By taking this loan, Hisham will be able to improve his family's conditions. Hisham appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 50-year-old married mother of nine children; three of them are still attending school. Six years ago, Salam started her own business by opening in her house a corner for vending housewares with her exceptional selling methods and by giving her customers a high quality of products. She is well known in her region for the special talents in her domain, in addition to the customer care she offers.

Today, Salam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her business merchandise, such as dishes, cups, tissues, and Tupperware, to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income.

Salam is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old, married and has three children still in school. 

Elma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, piglets, and other supplies.

Elma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, piglets, and other supplies

loans.name: Kaburisoke Ii Tukore Group

texts.en:
Hope is a hardworking married woman with two children aged five and eight years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a drug shop as her main source of income. She also does crop farming to earn additional income.

In this way, she has managed to earn a living, though she notes that poor weather changes have affected her garden, leading to poor and little yields. However, she has hopes of educating her children.

Hope is requesting a loan to buy more human drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.use: to buy more human drugs to sell in her drug shop.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 45, a married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school.

Enriqueta has a buy and sell condiments business in the Philippines. Enriqueta requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more condiments to sell like garlic, etc..

Enriqueta has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Enriqueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more condiments to sell like garlic, etc.to expand her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married, 47 years old and has three children with one child still in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of colognes, perfumes, and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Otila Lilia

texts.en:
Otila Lilia is 32 years old and a married woman with two children. 

She runs a small business selling pies, pork buns, pancakes, and donuts in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Otila Lilia has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, a box of chickens, yeast, baking powder, etc. 

She joined SPBD in April this year (2015) to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Otila Lilia will use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, a box of chickens, yeast, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Zamgoat

texts.en:
Zamgoat is Zambia's first commerical-scale aggregator, processor, and distributor of goat meat. Consumption of goat is second only to beef in Zambia, but unlike beef, it is rare to find goat in the markets of Lusaka and other cities.

Zamgoat not only addresses the growing demand by urban consumers, but at the same time addresses the poverty of the rural farmers, by monetizing the herds of goats they traditionally raise, for prestige more than income. Zamgoat is a mission-driven for-profit, with a mission of alleviating poverty of these farmers.

Zamgoat has been doing this for over three years. In that time they have worked with over 200 farmers, processed and sold over 2,300 goats, and earned over US$150,000. It has increased the income of those farmers by 10%. Given a country of 14 million people, the opportunity to grow is tremendous.

With this loan, Zamgoat will increase their sales. The money will be spent on more processing equipment, as well as refrigerated display cases in their retail store in Lusaka, Zambia, plus refrigerators behind the scenes for their wholesale distribution.

loans.use: increase its sales, providing additional processing equipment, including a refrigerated display case.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 20-year-old single man from Ramallah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. 

Waleed works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all his needs. Waleed also has a cafe and play station store in the city. 

Waleed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new games and computers for his cafe. This will increase his income and also his living conditions. 

Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new games and computers for his cafe

loans.name: Sharqiya

texts.en:
Sharqiya is 62 years old and married with two kids. They live poorly and for this reason her sons had to travel to Russia for work in order to help  family with their finances and to live better. Sharqiya's  husband is sick and cannot help his family. 

Sharqiya has 35 years of practice doing business in agriculture. She plants, cabbages, potatoes and other agricultural products. She is planning to plant one hectare of cabbages and another hectare of wheat . 

Sharqiya wants to have a good harvest this season and earn more money to live better. She tries her best to earn money and feed her family. She is asking for a loan 1,500 AZN from Kiva lenders to buy potato seeds, natural chemicals and fertilizers. She will plant and hopefully have a good harvest earning money to live better.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, natural chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 38-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife in a small humble house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity to save money. Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 54 years old, married and has six children.

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Violeta has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jose Miliano

texts.es:
José, de 43 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y agricultor que realiza siembra granos básicos; está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos. 

José, tiene más de 20 años preparando la tierra para sembrar granos básicos, él es el principal proveedor de maíz para varias vendedoras de tortillas de las ciudades aledañas. 

José, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para obtener una excelente producción de maíz y frijol para comercializarlos y favorecer su economía familiar. 

José, sueña con comprar un terreno grande que le permite seguir sembrando maíz y frijol,  pero que además tenga espacio para sembrar frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
José, 43 years old, is a humble man and a farmer who sows basic grains. He is in a relationship and has 2 children.

For more than 20 years, José has prepared the earth to sow basic grains. He is the main provider of corn for various tortilla sellers in the adjoining cities.

José is requesting the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to obtain an excellent production of corn and beans to sell and boost his familial economy.

José dreams of purchasing a large parcel of land that allows him to continue sowing corn and beans, but that also has space to sow fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shiela May

texts.en:
Shiela May is 22 years old with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Shiela May has been in this business for 3 years.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man from Dier El Balah City. His works is to transport clean water using his rickshaw. It is a good business and it provides him with a good income. After few years of working on this rickshaw, Ali would like to buy a new one to improve his business so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his work. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Ali appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his work.

loans.name: Shoimardon

texts.en:
Shoimardon is a very polite and well-mannered person. He is 37 years old, married and a father of two children. He lives in the region of J.Rumi. 

Shoimardon has more than 5 years of experience in crop production. His wife helps him. In this way, they make a living and provide for their children. 

Shoimardon plants vegetables and he needs to buy fertilizer. Therefore, he has applied for a loan. Shoimardon hopes that you do not refuse him help, and he promises that in the future will repay his loan on the time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Abdelkader

texts.en:
Abdel Kader is a married 46 year old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and six children five of them are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He began working as a painter since 1992. 

Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees. Hasan is very ambitious and he intends to work harder so as to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their requirements.

loans.use: to pay primary/secondary educational fees for his 5 children

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.en:
Hidaya, who is in her mid 30s, is married, with three children who are still in school. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 4pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hidaya's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stocks of grocery drinks and she has successfully paid back all of her loans. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, and cover household expenses.  

Hidaya will use this loan to buy out-of-stock drinks for her grocery store. She dreams of owning a big pub.

Hidaya will share this loan with her loan group, Florida Group, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy out-of-stock drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add some grocery items to her store and to pay for the renovation of her boarding house.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 50 years old, married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodora has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Nahid is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income can barely cover all of the family needs.

Nahid took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar water heating system for his family's house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, so it will save them money. Nahid appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for his family's house.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This courageous and hardworking woman is named Nasiba. She is 34 years old, married and lives with her family in the region of J.Rumi. Her husband is engaged in agriculture. 

Nasiba is involved in sewing. She has sewn for many years, but due to lack of money, she was not able to buy a modern sewing machine. Therefore, Nasiba was unable to produce anything. At the moment, they have no source of income and it is very hard to live. 

Nasiba decided to apply for a loan, in order to buy a new sewing machine and improve the living conditions of her family. She really needs help.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine so as to support her farmer husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the conditions of his bathroom since it does not offer privacy and it runs the risk of being exposed to winds, especially during the winter.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is 28 years old; he lives with his family in a small house.  He sells all kind of vegetables and fruits at his stall, where he started this business six years ago. This business helped the family income.  Reference his picture, Akram had an accident, so he has to wear a neck support. 

He applied for this loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits because he had shortage in his capital, so he would be able to increase his stock. He hopes to become a successful entrepreneur and his dream is to be well known in the city, so he tries to give the best service for his clients. 
Akram is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits because he had shortage in his capital.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is thankful that she was granted a 15000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 20000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Aside from her small store she also has a tricycle as transport service so part of the loan will be used for the maintenance. It is important that her unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her earnings helps sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Salina dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to improve the quality of their lives. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store and to pay for her tricycle maintenance as well.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 55 years old, and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family operating a food vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  She has been running the food vending business for 1 year and also earns an income from a general store.

Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Minh is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 52 year old Lebanese married mother of three children’s. In 2012, Rose started her own business, by opening in her house a small room for vending clothes and textiles with her special selling methods and by giving a high quality of products provided. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain. 

Today, Rose is asking for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise, with a special summer collection, to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. She is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection to further expand her earnings

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur in the Philippines with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs and supplements this income with earnings from her charcoal retailing and general store businesses.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosame

texts.en:
Rosame is married and works hard to support her family. She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc.

Rosame has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is 55 years old and married with one child. Blesilda works very hard to provide for them.

Blesilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and etc.

Blesilda has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, canned goods, noodles and etc

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 years old, married with three children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar etc.

Emily has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from an E-Loading station.

Emily aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar and etc

loans.name: Grupo Patzite Sector 3 Group

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 29 años de edad, es casada tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian en la escuela de su comunidad y los otros dos aun no estudian, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Magdalena (la última del lado derecho de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de papas y pollos fritos, ella  tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Magdalena gracias a su liderazgo  un grupo de personas han confiado en ella y la han nombrado su representante para solicitar un préstamo porque Magdalena tiene la necesidad de invertir un poco más en su negocio de papas y pollo y seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes la mejores papas y pollo frito.
Magdalena tiene las esperanzas de contar con un local donde pueda vender mejor y obtener mpas ingresos.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and has four children, two of whom study in their community school; the other two are not yet in school. This humble family lives in the community of Nahualá.

Magdalena (the last one on the right in the photograph), with the desire to obtain income and provide for her family, works selling fried potatoes and chicken. She has been doing this work for five years.

Thanks to Magdalena's leadership, a group of people have put their trust in her and have named her as their representative to request a loan. Magdalena has a need to invest a little more in her potato and chicken business and to continue offering her customers the best fried potatoes and chicken. 

Magdalena has hopes of having a shop where she can sell better and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell from her home as she needs more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to provide better transport services and productivity.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn used her previous loan for 20,000 PHP to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Marlyn requested another loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires, and netting needed for growing her ornaments to sell. Her income will help cover her family’s daily needs and fund her children's education. 

Marlyn hopes to expand her ornamental farm. She aims to improve her family's quality of life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gardening materials and supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Irene requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Irene has been in this business for 1 year now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Misesa Group

texts.en:
Anniah, a member of Misesa Group, is 31 years old and married, with four children. She sells different kinds of fruits, such as bananas, lemons and oranges. She started this business in order to financially support her family. 

Anniah wants to get a loan in order to buy more products for her business. Her main objective in getting the loan is to educate her children and to build a better house. 

The profits she makes from the loans she gets have helped her to build a house and to purchase a plot of land. There has been a positive impact since she started getting the loans since she is now self-reliant and able to provide food for her family without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman, 59 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lolita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mea

texts.en:
Mea is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mea is 30 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Mea has a ready to wear business in the Philippines. Mea requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear merchandise and other materials for her business.

Mea has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear merchandise and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nemia is 50 years old and has one child currently in school.

Nemia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nemia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil, utensils and other material for her food production business.

Nemia has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, cooking oil, utensils and other material for her food production business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Susana has a photographry business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts of cameras and other materials for her business.

Susana has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of cameras and other materials to her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nena is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Nena has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials to her business.

Nena has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy is a 33 year old married Lebanese woman, living with her husband and two children who will be attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, with her husband.  He is the main income provider for the family to help them to live in good conditions. 

Today, as her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school and purchase their books. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to register her children at school and purchase their books, so that they receive a good education

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thankful that she was granted a Php 22000 PHP loan which she used to buy piglets, feeds and medicines for her pigs. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like now to apply for Php 27000 which she will use to buy additional piglets, feeds and medicines to raise more healthy pigs. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. Her earning is a big help to cover their daily sustenance and to fund her children's education. 

Janet aims to sustain her piggery and start other types of business. She prays  that God will bless her family with enough for their needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for piglets, feed and medicines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 in which she used to buy additional containers of rice and sugar which she repacks and sells at retail to customers in her community. With her business doing well, she was able to repay her loan on time and still increase her income. The revenue of her income is use for their daily and school expenses of her child.

Elvira now has more stocks and added an electronic load in her store which is also patronized by her customers. But still her highest demand is for rice. 

Elvira is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy more contairners of rice and sugar to be repacked and sold at retail. 

Elvira's goal is to improve and sustain her store to help more not just in their daily expenses but most importantly for her child education.

loans.use: To buy more containers of rice and sugar to be repacked and sold at retail

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a small house. He works in the transport of goods on a rickshaw, where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family's needs.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, to save money.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Khánh

texts.en:
Khánh is 51 years old and she is married with two children. Khánh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Khánh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Khánh dreams her family can live in a hygienic environment, her children to do well in school and her business to do well in the future.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having money to build a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

She promise to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Phú Xuân, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 45 years old and she is married with six children. Xuân operates a food stall selling seafood. Xuân has been involved in this business for five years. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to sell. 

Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business in the future.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In 2013, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. 

Xuân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She always repays on time, and Xuân is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Phú Xuân, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members now.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is married, with five children, and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Gelma support the family through her agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Geljoe, 18 years old. He is the first of five children in the family; he is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the second semester of this four-year course.

Gelma is borrowing 9,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Geljoe for the second semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Geljoe plans, when he graduates, to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Ligaya

texts.en:
Ma. Ligaya is 42 years old and married with six children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Ligaya has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is married and for the past three years has worked hard at her business selling food that she has made. She has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, margarine, etc. to make more of her baked goods to sell. She would like to save enough of her profits to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, margarine, etc

loans.name: Myraluna

texts.en:
Myraluna is 38 years old, married and has three children. For the past three years she has worked hard running a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines, as well as farming rice.

Myraluna has borrowed and successfully repaid six prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now applying for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell in her store such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and drinks.

Myraluna aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Mabula Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, who is in her mid 50s is married with five children, who are still going to school.  She has been running two projects, a genge (women's wrap arounds) and selling spare parts for seven years now.  She works from 08am to 06.30pm daily and is able to make a very good month profit.

This will be BEATRICE's5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the genge business and bought the fast moving items in the spare parts stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, bought a plo5 of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the genge stock and to increase on the spares parts stock to meet her customer's demand. She dreams of building her own house. 

Beatrice will share this loan with her group Mabula which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the genge (wrap arounds)  stock and to increase on the spares parts stock to meet her customer's demand.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Han is 57 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province

In 2015, Han joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Han has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Han faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Han hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks to build a toilet for the health of her family

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is single, 30 years old and has two children.  One child is still in school.

Nemia is in the agricultural business, poultry in the Philippines. Nemia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other poultry supplies.

Nemia has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other poultry supplies

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José es un hombre que ha aprendido a trabajar desde muy pequeño, siempre ha luchado por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de las personas que ama. El hace once años emprendió un negocio de venta de granos básicos a las pulperías de su pueblo. Luego empezó a trabajar con mayor capital, con el cual compro grandes cantidades de arroz y frijoles, granos que vendió en tiempo de escases y le generaron buenas ganancias, con las que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y mejorar su casa. 
En estos momentos, este trabajador hombre, ha vuelto a solicitar un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar arroz, frijoles y maíz. El negocio de José se está volviendo muy rentable dado que ha logrado conseguir buenos proveedores y una buena cartera de clientes. En un futuro se ve distribuyendo productos a los mercados fuera de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Jose is a man who has been learning to work since he was very small. He has always battled to improve his quality of life and that of the people he loves. Some eleven years ago Jose learned how to operate a business selling basic grains to the local grocery stores. Later, he began working with more capital, enabling him to buy large quantities of rice, beans, and grains that he could sell in times of scarcity, generating good earnings. This enabled him to improve the quality of life of his children as well as improve his house.

At the present time, this hard-working man has decided to request a loan from Kiva and MiCredito to purchase more rice, beans, and corn. Jose's business  is proving to be very profitable, since he has managed to acquire good sources of grains and a good list of customers. 

In the future, Jose would like to distribute his products to the markets outside his town.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and corn to sell to the grocery stores in his town.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Charlyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Charlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business so as to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Rosa Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, que junto a su madre comercializan pescado, pero también cultivan maíz y frijol para subsistir.

Evelyn, tiene experiencia en su trabajo a pesar de su corta edad, debido a que desde pequeña junto a su madre, realizaba actividades de pesca y de cultivos, además se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos para los habitantes de la comunidad donde reside.

Evelyn, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para la cosecha que ya se encuentra en vigor y que por falta de condiciones económicas no había podido preparar.

Evelyn, sueña en el futuro con poner una tienda en su casa, en donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad y así tener un ingreso permanente para su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a 22 year old single mother of two, who sells fish with her mother, and also grows corn and beans. Despite her young age, Evelyn is experienced in her profession; she has been fishing and farming with her mother since childhood. She also sells traditional dishes to people in her community.

Evelyn needs this loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides for the harvest, as it is already in production, which her lack of economic resources has left her unable to prepare for.

Evelyn dreams of a future where she can have a shop in her home, where she can sell basic goods, and thus have a permanent income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a drain to install a toilet, which is more hygienic and more comfortable for his family than the latrine

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 46 years old and a resident of Pasay City. She has one child whom she loves very much. Managing the household while operating a business means she is working hard to continually provide an income to cover the family’s everyday expenses.

These days, computers are a large part of everyone’s lives. Figuratively, a computer is like the oxygen everyone needs, everywhere from an individual to the biggest institutions within the society. This is why she has chosen to make computers the center of her chosen business.

Here in the Philippines most of the population cannot afford to buy their own computer. For those who can’t, entrepreneurs like Marivic have set up internet cafes where customers can have access to the internet at a per-hour cost. Prices usually range from 10 to 15 PHP an hour, which is very reasonable for the average person.

However, what income Marivic gets from her business is not quite enough to provide for all of her household needs. She would like to expand her café to provide her with an increase in profits. To do so she is humbly requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to buy additional computers and other materials needed to renovate her café.

Besides her café Marivic also rents rooms to create additional income and would like to expand this operation. Through these businesses she hopes to have a sustainable livelihood in the near future. She would like to offer thanks and deepest appreciation to those who will help her accomplish these visions.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients like Marivic are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional computer units and other materials needed for the renovation of her internet cafe.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Juana vive en una ciudad llena de cultura y tradiciones, ella posee un negocio de creación y alquiler de muñecas gigantonas. Estas muñecas gigantes que bailan por toda la ciudad, en donde vive esta creativa mujer, han sido su fuente de ingreso por dieciséis años. Su esposo e hijos la apoyan en las largas noches de trabajo al hacer los vestidos, los cabellos y pintar las máscaras de forma exuberante. 
En estos momentos, Juana necesita invertir en su negocio, es por eso que ha solicitado la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le ayude para comprar nuevas muñecas para alquilar. En un futuro desea poner un taller de creación de muñecas gigantonas, en donde piensa impartir clases, también tiene planes de mejorar su casa y sacar a sus dos hijos adelantes.
texts.en:
Juana lives in a city filled with culture and traditions. She owns a business where she creates and rents gigantic dolls. These giant dolls dance throughout the city, where this creative woman lives. This has been her source of income for sixteen years. Her husband and children help her during the long nights of work to make the outfits, hair, and to paint the masks exuberantly.

Currently, Juana needs to invest in her business, which is why she has enlisted the help of Kiva with MiCrédito to be granted a loan to help her buy new dolls to rent. In the future she would like to have a giant doll workshop, where she would teach classes. She also has plans to improve her house and help her sons get ahead.

loans.use: to buy new dolls to rent.

loans.name: Rosalia Ruth

texts.en:
Rosalia Ruth is married, 52 years old and has six children.  Two children are still in school.

Rosalia Ruth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalia Ruth requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalia Ruth has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José, de 75 años de edad, es un hombre de la tercera edad, es viudo y vive con un sobrino que lo considera como un hijo.

José, tiene más de 30 años de poseer una tienda en el centro del pueblo, donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y que por motivos de salud es su sobrino quien la administra hoy en día.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar más productos para surtir su tienda y poder mantener el prestigio y la capacidad de ofrecer todo tipo de productos a sus clientes.

José, sueña con tener un mini-super en su pueblo, pues ese a sido siempre su sueño.
texts.en:
José, 75 years of age, is an elderly man. He is a widower and lives with a nephew, whom he thinks of as a son. 

For more than 30 years, José has owned a shop in the centre of the village, where he sells basic staple goods. For health reasons, it is his nephew who manages the shop these days.

José needs this loan to buy more products to stock his shop, allowing him to maintain its reputation and ability to offer all kinds of products to his customers.

José dreams of one day having a mini-supermarket in his village. This has always been his dream.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his shop.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Angeline is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell in her buy and sell coconut wine business.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 28-year-old Lebanese married mother of two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children and works hard, trying her best to help her family. She started her own business in 2013, opening a beauty salon. She has her loyal customers, and she is happy and satisfied with the results she has attained so far. She is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase goods for her salon such as scissors and a hair dryer. Then, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her work such as scissors and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Marissa and recently she was granted a loan of PHP 30,000 for her junk shop business. Marissa was so glad that she was given a chance to use the loan for the improvement of her business. 

She is asking again for your help. She believes that people like you can change her fate. She is taking out a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

With optimism and hope, she envisions herself with her own canteen someday and her children with their own professions after schooling. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
