*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials from collectors.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old and married with seven children. With three children still in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, cooffee, drinks and etc

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charlita is 42 years old and her children are in school.

Charlita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Charlita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Charlita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Charlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 22-years-old single man from Khan Younis city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in selling cosmetics at a stall. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income.

Haytham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his business to resell. By taking this loan, Haytham will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Haytham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his business to resell.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Adoracion is a snack vendor and sells rice cakes, jam and banana-que. She is widowed and has six grown-up children. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to expand her business. She will buy more bananas, rice cakes, ube and peanuts to sell. Adoracion hopes to keep selling delicious snacks while providing friendly service to all her customers. She will save money to use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, rice cakes, ube and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Ivin

texts.en: Ivin is 46 years old and married with six children. Her family lives in Solana. Ivin is a vegetable vendor while her spouse is a mechanic. Their income supports the family’s daily needs and also pays education expenses. She wants to sell more vegetables and needs additional capital. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy eggplant, tomatoes, cabbage and beans to sell. Vending more vegetables will give her more profit in return.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, cabbage and beans to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy rice, sugar, coffee powder, and fruit-drink powder to sell in her store.

Julie's business is doing well and was able to repay her loan on time. The generated income was able to support her child's continuing treatment and school expenses of her other children.

Julie is on her sixth loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy noodles, biscuits, snack foods, assorted shampoo and laundry soaps as added items to sell in her store.
Julie is still active selling her puto (rice cakes) and ice cream to generate addiional income.

Julie wanted to sustain and improve her store to help pay more of her family's expenses, especially for the continuous treatment of her child and education of her other children.

loans.use: To buy noodles, biscuits, snack foods, assorted shampoo and laundry soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 58 years old, married and has ten children.

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Violeta has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married, 43 years old and has five children of which, four are presently in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 53 year old Lebanese widowed woman living with her five children. After her husband’s death, she became responsible for raising her children on her own. Facing bad financial circumstances alone, she was obligated to work really hard to carry on and support her children. She raises cattle, and she produces daily fresh milk, which she sells to multiple customers and traders. She works in parallel in a local school. She seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase fodder to feed the cows and to be able to increase the quantity of milk that they produce.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to feed cows.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un joven emprendedor que lleva 4 años trabajando en el transporte de materiales de construcción. Para ello cuenta con un vehículo de carga, solicita un préstamo de $500, con este dinero  comprará dos llantas para mejorar las condiciones del vehículo, y continuar con su trabajo y de esta forma incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Luis is a young entrepreneur who has been working in the transport of construction materials for 4 years. He relies on a cargo vehicle for this work. He is requesting for a loan of $500, and with this money, he will buy two tires to improve the vehicle's condition, continue with his work, and by doing so increase his earnings.

loans.use: to maintenance of the dump truck

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 59 years old and married with six children. Consolacion works very hard to provide for them.

Consolacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Consolacion has been in this business for 34 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beverages, bread, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Akouyovi

texts.fr: Akouyovi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans. Mère d’un enfant, Akouyovi vit à Adakpamé pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Akouyovi vend des pagnes dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Akouyovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Akouyovi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouyovi is a married woman aged 38. The mother of one child, Akouyovi lives in Adakpamé and undertakes her business there. In order to meet the needs of her family, Akouyovi sells lengths of African print cloth in the neighborhood on foot to earn income. She stocks up three times a month at the market. 

Wishing to have new inventory, Akouyovi is requesting this loan to buy lengths of pagne (wax cloth) that she will sell and make a good profit so as to help her husband with the daily needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Abdl Kareem

texts.en:
Abdl Kareem is a 29-year-old, single man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to assist with all the family needs.

Abdl Kareem took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will help him provide hot water without using electricity, thereby saving money. Abdl Kareem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Hayla

texts.en:
Hayla is a 40 year old Lebanese woman living with her parents. She is working hard to provide her family with extra financial aid and to help her father, who is the main income provider in the family.  In 2006, she opened her own beauty salon in her town near to her house and attract a good number of loyal customers, which makes her happy and satisfied. 

She is requesting to take a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.to purchase new accessories for her business and to renovate her salon in order to improve her productivity. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new accessories for her beauty salon and to renovate the premises for better productivity

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is grateful that she was granted a PHP 50,000 loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental plant business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires, and netting that she needs to grow her ornamental plants to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Josefina dreams to grow and be more successful in her ornamental plant farm. She aims to improve the family's quality of life and she prays for healthy living. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials needed in her business, such as wire and baskets, and supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 years old and is married with five children who are in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Emily has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, eggs, etc. for her restaurant business. Lutgarda has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from her general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lutgarda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, eggs, etc

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is thankful for his first Kiva loan which helped him to develop his trading business. Today he is a farmer as he closed his business, and he became engaged only in farming, in which he was interested since his very young age. Now he is the owner of a lovely farm that, many years ago, was established by his father who left it to his only son. 

Now in his native village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region, Andranik lives with his nice family (he has two daughters and a son) and takes care of his farm. Here he has cows, calves, a pig and heifers. Andramik sells a lot of milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd, and also meat (beef, pork and mutton).

 For his farm products Andranik has his regular customers and also re-sellers from the city. In order to enlarge the sale of dairy products from his farm, Andranik decided to ask Kiva lenders for a loan for the second time. With this loan amount he will buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails and wire to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anacris

texts.en:
Anacris is a diligent wife and mother of three children. While her husband operates their tricycle for passenger transportation, Anacris is engaged in her retailing business. She is selling groceries in their village. While waiting for customers to serve, Anacris also manages a livestock business for additional income. She usually invests her income from her retailing business in the feed for her hogs. 

Anacris wants to earn bigger income to be able to sustain her hogs' feed. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy more canned goods, diapers, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, and condiments to sell. Anacris will do her best to make her business progress as a way toward a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, diapers, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit avec cinq enfants à Adamavo. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Akouvi vend des vins et des boissons  dans le quartier. Akouvi réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne dix fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des cartons de vins, Akouvi demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
At 35, Akouvi is a married woman who lives with five children in Adamavo. In order to allow them to flourish, Akouvi sells wine and other drinks in the neighborhood. She makes a living from this and she stocks up 10 times a month at the market. 

In order to buy some cartons of wine, Akouvi is requesting these funds to promote her order and have a profit margin which will help her contribute more toward family expenses.

loans.use: to buy seven cartons of wine

loans.name: Badouba Group

texts.fr: Badouba est un groupe de 7 femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Ce groupe travaille avec ACFIME depuis 2008 et jusque là tout se passe bien. Maïmouna, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et scolarisés. Cette brave dame gère sa boutique. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour approvisionner sa boutique en divers article( savon, lait, bonbon, huile, sucre,...). En plus de la boutique, Maïmouna aimerait acheter de l'arachide pour vendre. Après les ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité et aussi de faire les dépenses de sa maison.
texts.en: Badouba is a group of seven women who all have businesses.  The group has worked with ACFIME (a microfinance institution) since 2008, and until then everything was going well.  Maïmouna, the representative member, is married and mother to five school children. This brave lady manages her shop.  She needs a loan to stock her shop with various items (soap, milk, sweets, oil, sugar, etc.).  As well as the shop, Maïmouna would like to buy some peanuts to sell. From the sales, she will have profits which will allow her to continue with her business and meet her housing expenses.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise to sell in her small shop.

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es: Manuela es una mujer emprendedora, madre de 3 hijos tiene un negocio de libreria desde hace 5 años,sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven cerca a su casa, el prestamo que solicito es para implementar su libreria y tener un negocio surtido y grande, Manuela lleva 7 años dentro del grupo  "Lider de  defensores" Un grupo muy unido que se apoya mutuamente y llevan una buena relacion amical desde hace mucho,Manuela es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido vencer muchos obstaculos que se le han presentado en el camino como la envidia de algunas personas que no les gusta ver que progrese, Manuela agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el prestamo brindado y dice que jamas a dejar de luchar por sus sueños y espera que la ayuda continue.
texts.en:
Manuela is a hard-working woman and the mother of three children. She has had a bookshop business for the past five years, her main customers are her neighbours and friends who live close to her home. 

The loan that Manuela is seeking is to grow her bookshop, to have a well-stocked and decent sized business. Manuela has been part of the group "Lider de Defensores" for the last seven years. Manuela is a fighter, she has had to overcome many obstacles to get where she is today, such as the envy of others who don't like her success. 

Manuela is very thankful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered and she says that she will never stop fighting for her dreams and she hopes that their support will continue.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their book-store

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario emprendedoras está conformado por tres personas laboriosas, coordinado por la señora yelba de 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos, desde hace quince años, solicita por treceava vez el financiamiento de ADIM, con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la oferta de productos e invirtió en la compra de telas de cobertores, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de ropa, camisas, faldas, pantalones. La segunda socia es doña María de 56 años de edad propietaria de una librería y el tercer socio es don Manuel de 51 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de lotería.
texts.en: The "Emprendedoras" communal bank is made up of 3 laborious members coordinated by Yelba who is 55 years old; she has worked selling new clothing and shoes for 15 years. She is requesting her 3rd loan from ADIM. With her previous loan she managed to increase the products she offers and invested in the purchase of bedspreads. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing, shirts, skirts and pants. The second member is Ms. María who is 56 years old and is the owner of a bookstore. The third member is Manuel who is 51 years old and sells lottery tickets.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shirts, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit à Adakpamé et est âgée de 30 ans. Mariée, Afi est mère de quatre enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Afi vend des bois de chauffage dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu nécessaire pour leur subsistance. Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des troncs de bois, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en: Afi lives in Adakapamé and is 30 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children - she works dynamically to help their education.  Afi sells firewood in her neighbourhood and the surrounding areas to gain an income which she needs to sustain herself.  She buys stock once a month from the market.  In order to buy some tree trunks, Afi is asking for a loan to meet her spending and make her profits.

loans.use: to buy five tree trunks for firewood.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Like other people, what Criselda dreams of for her family is just to get out from under the breadline and have a more affordable kind of life someday. Aiming to fast track this, Criselda manages her current business (sari-sari store) with a lot of passion and diligence. Recently, she took a loan that was faithfully paid back. With the given amount of PHP 10,000, she was able to supply her store with a sufficient enough supply of grocery items to sell as a source of income.

To continue to improve her current inventory, she would like to request again a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 that she will use to buy more stocks and supplies of merchandise and products. If granted, this will be a wide-open opportunity for her to increase her income profit. If this happens, it will greatly ease the burden of her family's expenditures.

For now, she would like to offer you her sincerest thanks.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks and supplies of merchandise and products for her business.

loans.name: Enaam

texts.en:
Enaam is a 42 year old married woman living with her husband and five children, three of whom are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider in the family He owns a van for transportation and also he rents a shop but he earns a barely sufficient income.

That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay for her children's educational fees. She is very eager to make use of the loan as her only purpose is to support her children to get an education for them to be competitive with others and reach higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. Todas están dentro del programa de comité de mujeres y luchan por ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Luisa, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, es una mujer muy buena en las ventas y es por eso que tiene ya muchos clientes, es una persona que quiere capacitarse, y es por ello que pone todo de sí en las capacitaciones del programa de comités.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras frescas para poder seguir con sus vetas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe group is in its fourth loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, where they develop their teamwork, helping and supporting one another. They are all in the women's communal bank program and struggling, little by little, to overcome their state of poverty.

Luisa, one of the group's members, sells fruit and vegetables for a living. She is a very good saleswoman and that's why she now has many customers. She is someone who wants to improve herself, which is why she is throwing herself into the women's communal bank training.

She is applying for this loan to buy fresh fruit and vegetables so that she can carry on selling as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she has to be able to improve.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Cherry Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a vulcanizing shop. Cherry Ann is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: A 39 ans, Akouyo est une femme mariée et vit avec quatre enfants à Adakpamé. Bien consciente de son état, elle vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Akouyo  achète son stock auprès de ses fournisseurs trois fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Akouyo désire ce crédit pour commander des paniers de tomates et des légumes afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Akouyo is a 39 year old lady who is married and lives with her four children in Adakpamé.  She is very aware of her situation and sells general foodstuffs in her neighbourhood to make a profit which covers daily expenditures.  Akouyo buys her stock from providers three times a month which gives her enough profit.  She would like this loan to buy some baskets of tomatoes and vegetables in order to make profits and meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy five baskets of tomatoes and some vegetables.

loans.name: Elba Roxana

texts.es:
Elba, vive con su esposo quien es empleado y sus dos hijas que están solteras y tienen 23 y 25 años de edad, Elba administra una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta básica, la fundo hace 6 años, tiene un horario de atención a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche.
El capital lo utilizara básicamente para comprar granos básicos, huevos, sal, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, etc., ofrecerá mercadería nueva a sus clientes para aumentar su capacidad de venta y tener nuevos ingresos.
Para Elba es muy importante seguir trabajando para lograr que su negocio sobresalga en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elba lives with her husband, who is employed, and her two unmarried daughters, who are 23 and 25 years old. Elba manages a shop that she founded 6 years ago, where she offers basic goods products to her customers. Her hours of customer service are from six in the morning to eight at night. 

Basically, she will use the capital to purchase basic grains, eggs, salt, sugar, oil, beverages, etc. She will offer new merchandise to her customers, so as to increase her sales capacity and to earn new income. For Elba, it is very important to continue working in order to have her business stand out in her community.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, eggs, salt, sugar, oil, beverages, etc.; to offer new merchandise to her customers

loans.name: Santos Saúl

texts.es:
Santos es un productor de café desde hace 5 años, antes se había dedicado únicamente a la producción de cacao, pero como su finca se ubica en una zona con potencial para los dos rubros, decidió cultivar café porque es un rubro rentable, según menciona este pequeño productor.

Actualmente, Santos tiene dificultades para el manejo post-cosecha de su café, ya que no cuenta con una infraestructura que le permita manejar adecuadamente su producción. Por tal razón, está solicitando un financiamiento para construir un beneficio húmedo en su finca, con lo cual mejorará los rendimientos y calidad de su café y con ello incrementará los ingresos para su familia.

En un futuro, él espera contar con una finca autosostenible, y con una producción constante que supere en un 150% la actual. Por lo que ha diseñado un plan de mejoramiento integral de su finca.
texts.en:
Santos has been growing coffee for five years. Before that, he used to grow cocoa only. His land is located in an area where both grow very well, so he decided to start growing coffee, which is a profitable activity according to this small farmer.

Santos is now having problems to handle what he harvests because he does not have the adequate infrastructure to take care of his production. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to build a structure where he can process the ripe cherries to obtain dry parchment coffee. This will help him to improve the productivity and the quality of his coffee, which will result in more income for his family.

In the future, he hopes to have a self-sustainable farm with a stable production 150% larger than the current one. To reach this goal, he has designed an integral improvement plan for his farm.

loans.use: to build a structure to process the ripe cherries and obtain dry parchment coffee.

loans.name: Franco Kilderd

texts.es:
El socio Franco pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio Franco continúa dedicándose a su negocio de  imprenta, referente a diseño de publicidad  de empresa, el socio Franco agradece a  KIVA por permitirle adquirir una herramienta que le ayude en su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de una laptop.
texts.en:
This borrower is Franco, who belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II” ["Lord of the Earthquakes II"] of the city of Cusco, Peru. 

Franco continues to dedicate himself to his printing business. With reference to designing publicity materials for businesses, Franco is grateful to Kiva for enabling him to acquire a tool which will help him in his work. He would like to continue working in order to keep supporting his family. 

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to carry out maintenance on a laptop.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on a laptop.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара проживает на районе Шахритус. Ей 53 года. Она замужем за рабочего строителя. У них пятеро детей. Тамара живет вместе с мужем. Ее дети находятся в Российской Федерации. Тамара дома занимается животноводческой деятельности. У нее не большое количество скотин. Она хочет изменить ситуацию. Она планирует расширить деятельность, приобрести еще пару голов скотов и увеличить доходность. У Тамары не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы совершить покупку и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Tamara  lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 53 years old, married to a construction worker. They have five children. Tamara and her husband live together while their children are away in Russia. 

Tamara is involved in breeding livestock. She has only few animals, but she wants to change this state of affairs. She is planning to expand the business by purchasing several head of livestock and increasing profitability. Tamara lacks a small sum of money to settle the deal, which is why she requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia Virginia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA.
 La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de hotel, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual  le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the communal bank Virgen del Carmen de Yanahuara.  She works daily in the hotel business.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time and things are going well thanks to the efforts that she puts forth each day.  She wants to be able to continue working in this way in order to support her family. 

Virginia is requesting a loan in order to buy sheets, among other items.  

She is thankful to those who form part of this dream via Kiva lending and she promises to comply with all repayment requirements by the established deadlines.

loans.use: To purchase sheets and other items for the running of her hotel.

loans.name: Korotoumou's Group

texts.fr: Korotoumou qui se trouve sur la photo portant le boubou noir, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bancoumana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Korotoumou, âgée de 52 ans, est la mère de 10 enfants, dont 9 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Korotoumou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Korotoumou cultive l'arachide, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Korotoumou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des formations et techniques agricoles, ainsi que de l'accès au marché. Cette année Korotoumou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Korotoumou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Korotoumou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Korotoumou espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Korotoumou, who is wearing the black boubou in the picture, is a member of a group of 11 farmers registered with myAgro. She lives and works in the village of Bancoumana in the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Korotoumou is 52 years old and the mother of ten children, nine of them currently attend school.

Korotoumou was encouraged to take part in this activity as farming is a family tradition and has been the main source of income and food for the home. Furthermore, she loves farming and has been doing so for 30 years.

Korotoumoou grows peanuts on her plot but faces farming difficulties like a lack of farming materials and quality fertiliser.  She is starting her first year with myAgro and registered herself to obtain quality seeds and farming training and techniques, as well as access to the market.

This year Korotoumou is making payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser to increase production on her 0.0625 hectare plot.  It is now 20 years that she has been growing quality peanuts. She explains that the peanuts are eaten by the family and used as a sauce base in cooking and also used for their commercial value as they can be sold in the market. She plans to increase her production and her profit to buy farming materials.  

In the end, Korotoumou hopes to build a house for the family and ensure that they can provide food for themselves.

loans.use: to allow her to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, runners, buttons, thread and other raw materials so she can respond to the market demand.

loans.name: 06 Phú Vượng, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell.

Xuân is 29 years old and she is married, with three children. She is the group leader of the 06 Phú Vượng, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2014, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability.

Xuân has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and married with three children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elena is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgé de 42 ans, Afi est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec quatre enfants à charge, Afi habite à Adakpamé pour vendre de la pate bandée pour la restauration de ses clients. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Afi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter un sac de maïs, des poissons et des sachets d’eau, Afi demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Afi is 42 years old and married, she is a very resourceful and active lady when it comes to managing her needs.  Afi has four children to look after.  She lives in Adakpamé and sells strips of pastry to cater for her clients.  The business brings her profits and she buys stock once a month from the market.  In order to buy a bag of maize, some fish and some water sachets, Afi is asking for a loan to pay for her order and make profits to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize, seven crates of fish and 30 water sachets.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives in Tsovayugh village of Gegharkunik region. Vardan used to work as a welder but now his only occupation is farming. On this farm Vardan takes care of a cow, a calf, a heifer, sheep and a lot of chickens. With the help of his wife and retired mother Vardan sells he his farm’s excess milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product), meat and also eggs. Vardan is also good in land cultivation and works especially in potato production. His land’s potato crop,  he sells to re-sellers who give rather big orders. The prices as Vardan mentions are not profitable for farmers but wholesale is very profitable for any peasant family,which solves the problem of taking the product to wholesale market and finding customers for the sale. This loan of 250.000 Armenian drams Vardan will use for the purchase of potato seedlings and also fertilizer for his plot of land.

loans.use: for the purchase of potato seedlings and also fertilizer for his plot of land

loans.name: Nelson Patricio

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre de 31 años de edad ,  actualmente se encuentra  casado y tiene tres hijos, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades. 
Ahora Nelson vive junto a su familia en la parroquia Toacazo del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Este sector  está ubicado en el noroccidente de la provincia, es una zona rural su clima es muy frio, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Nelson heredó de sus padres la habilidad para la crianza y venta de cerdos, y producción de maiz, dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día paralelamente con las actividades del hogar . Nelson con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años, se siente preparado para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual que harán que su producción aumente para que pueda mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia, 
Además a Nelson le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Nelson agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Nelson is 31 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Thanks to the efforts of his parents, he was able to complete primary school. Then, due to the lack of economic resources, he has worked since he was very young to be able to sustain his necesities.

Now, Nelson lives with his family in the parish of Toacazo del Canton Latacunga, located in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador.  This area is located in the northwest of the province.  It is a rural area with a cold climate.  The majority of the people in this area work in agriculture and in the raising of small animals.  The climate and geography also effect the harvests, which are products of the Sierra Region.  The inhabitants live from day to day with these occupations.  Although it is a place far from the city, these families have undertaken all sorts of activities in order to pay for their necessities and the necessities of their community. 

Nelson inherited from his parents the skill of raising and selling pigs as well as the production of corn.  He works at this between 8 and 10 hours every day along with the chores related to the home.  With the experience that Nelson has acquired through the years, he feels ready to take the step of growing his business in order increase his production so that he can improve his lifestyle and that of his family.

Besides, in the future, Nelson would like to buy a vehicle which would allow him to go to more clients who ask for his product.  Nelson is grateful to the Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth of his working life and his personal life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed.  In the future he wishes to have better transportation and grow his business

loans.name: Deby's Group

texts.fr: Deby, à gauche sur la photo et portant un foulard blanc, est membre d'un groupe de 8 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Toba, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Deby, qui est âgé de 60 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 10 personnes. L’agriculture lui permit de cultiver l'arachide pour nourrir la famille.  Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Deby a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Deby espère pouvoir assurer l’éducation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Deby, who is on the left of the photo wearing a white headscarf, is a member of a group of eight farmers who live and work in the village of Toba in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Deby is 60 years old and lives in a family consisting of ten people.

Farming allows her to grow peanuts to feed her family.  In her first year with myAgro, Deby bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts on her 0.0625 hectare field.  Through purchasing this, Deby hopes to be able to guarantee an education for her family.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Thanks for your support and act of kindness. You just don't know how you helped Emma. With the amount 
PHP 20,000 that you recently lent her, she was able to add more stuffs and grocery items in her small sari-sari store business, thus, enabling her to earn a little higher profit than usual, which, she used in supplying the needs of her household. 

This time, she wants to ask again for another PHP 35,000 loan.She will be utilizing this to purchase more products to sell in her variety store. With this, she and her family can surely benefit, having the opportunity to be a little bit better in every day. If she'll be able to save enough money, then she could finally start building her dreams to expand her business. Then someday, she envisions herself handling her own branch. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
There is great demand now for computers. Making a wise choice, Gloria, 42, residing at Pasay City, Philippines, has just decided recently to be involved with a computer shop business. She is married to Justino and has been into the business for only four months now. Being new with the field, she would like to ask help from you. 

She wants to maintain this business for a long-term enterprise. With this, she wants to ask a financial assistance amounting to PHP 15,000 that she needs to improve her computer shop and buy an extra PC unit for additional use within the shop. Through this, she is sure and hopeful that she'll be able to develop more her inventory. Ever since, she wanted this because she wants to sustain her family with a better kind of living. 

What she only dreams is nothing else but the good of her children. She wants them to finish college and have professional jobs. 

Gloria meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to improve her computer shop and buy an extra PC unit for additional use within the shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married, with two children and has a pig raising business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Victoria has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is 24 years old, married and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Era requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Era has been farming vegetable for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Era would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies, so as to expand her business

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish ponds operation. 

Purita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en: Khachatur is 42 years old and with his nice wife and two pretty daughters (they are school-aged) he lives in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Khachatur used to work at the gas station and he combined this work with farming. Now his only occupation is farming in which his wife (she works as a teacher at the school) greatly helps him.  Khachatur’s farm is small one; there he has cows and heifers. The milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and meat,  are his farm products for sale which provides income for his family living. This income is too small to provide good living conditions for his family, so Khachatur hopes that in near future he will have the  chance to enlarge his farm with more cattle and have more income from it. Still he will be very thankful if Kiva lenders help him with loan amount to buy fodder for his farm cattle since it has lack of it.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle since it has lack of it

loans.name: Rabiaza Dany

texts.fr:
Dany a 47 ans, elle est mariée et son mari travaille comme chauffeur dans une société commerciale. Les deux époux savent bien s'entraider mutuellement pour le bien-être de la famille. Elle a trois enfants dont deux encore à charge et scolarisés. La famille vie actuellement dans une maison à location et envisage d'en construire pour son propre compte dans l'avenir.  
Dany dirige un magasin général depuis 2012. Mais elle était dans le secteur commerce depuis déjà très long temps. Son magasin se situe dans un bon emplacement et elle a beaucoup de clients. Sa demande de crédit a pour objet de renforcer son capital, d'améliorer son exploitation afin d'en tirer plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Dany is 47 years old and married. Her husband works as a driver for a trading company. This couple knows how to work together for the well-being of their family. They have three children together, two of which are still living under their care and are currently receiving an education. The family currently lives in a rented house and are planning on building their own in the future.

Dany has been running a general store since 2012. But she has worked in the commercial sector for a long time. Her store is situated in a good location and she has a lot of customers. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her working capital and improve her business so that she can earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and cooked meats

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene más de 3 años de haber iniciado su negocio de venta de ropa. Ella se siente agradecida porque gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito ha podido invertir en la compra de mercadería, lo cual le ha permitido obtener mejores ganancias y ampliar su negocio. De esta forma, puede mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Ella es una mujer perseverante y trabajadora, por ello solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, camisas, calcetines, talladores, además de cambiarse a nueva vivienda, esto le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de ropa y mudarse a un lugar mejor para ella y su familia. María planea continuar trabajando con MiCrédito y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: María Elena started her business selling clothing more than 3 years ago. She feels grateful because thanks to the fundings from MiCrédito, she has been able to invest in purchasing merchandise, which has allowed her to get better earnings and broaden her business. This way she can improve her family's living conditions. She is a persistent and hard-working woman. Therefore, she is asking for a new loan to buy undergarments, shirts, socks, bras, as well as to move to a new house. This will help her a lot because she will be able to offer a greater variety of clothing and move to a better place for her and her family. María plans to continue working with MiCrédito and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, shirts, socks, bras, and jeans.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia es una persona que esta poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de su familia por medio de su carrera, que es la de notaría. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar la matricula de su carrera.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de sus útiles de universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, luchando con sus metas.
texts.en: Cynthia is a person that is giving her all to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family through her career, which is a notary. She says that her previous loan was used to pay her degree enrollment. Now she is asking for this new loan to be able to invest in buying her university tools, and with that she can continue with her studies as she has been doing, fighting for her goals.

loans.use: to buy university tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her hotel like cooking oil, maize flour, rice and beef for cooking

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia Serafina  pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN CHANCA.
La socia tiene 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la  venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros. 
La socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the communal bank VIRGEN CHANCA. She is 54 years old, married and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities, making a living by selling staple products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, bread, sodas, beer and other items. She has worked in her business for a long time, which is going well thanks to the efforts she puts in every day in her work. She is a responsible and persevering person, and in this way gets by with her family. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, and other items. She thanks the investors for the loan and is happy for the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 33-years-old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.  Jean works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Jean has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer 23 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a su hijo en una comunidad de Nahualá.
María con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, este pequeño negocio lo tiene ella desde hace seis años.
María gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas y así poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de María es poder agrandar su tienda para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: María is a 23 year old woman. She is single and lives with her son in a community of Nahualá. With the eagerness to get her income and support her family, she relies on a small shop for buying and selling groceries. She has had this small business for six years. Thanks to the friendliness that she shows her clients, María now sees the need to ask for a loan to be able to buy products such as rice, sugar, sweets, and soft drinks to be able to better satisfy the needs of those clients. María's big dream is to be able to enlarge her business to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a new client to the institution. She is married and has two children. She has a lock-up in the central market where she deals in the sale of agricultural produce i.e. beans, millet, groundnuts, rice and posho. She has done her business for a period of five years. However, she has been hindered by limited capital to expand her business. Therefore, she decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance and applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to add stock in her business i.e. posho, beans, and rice so as to earn more income. Moreen hopes with financial assistance from UGAFODE, she will be able to make more profits from her business and she encourages UGAFODE to continue supporting low income earners since it improves people’s incomes and living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock of corn flour, beans and rice

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Josphine, a member of Jipe Moyo Group. She is 58-years-old, married and has a family of 7 children.  She is a dairy and maize farmer. She also runs a grocery business selling watermelons to supplement her farming income. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to be trained on enterprise management and development. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of watermelons to her grocery business. 

Josphine is grateful to Kiva and its lenders as they will help her to expand her business, thus be in a position to provide for the family and her personal needs with ease.

loans.use: To buy more stock of watermelons thus boost sales that will increase income.

loans.name: Sur Group

texts.es:
Marioly es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un bebe de 1 año, y su negocio es la manicura y venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad,
caracterizado por tener muchos parques ecológicos, plazas y canchas multi deportivas. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el die entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Marioly es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura media, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (esta con un bebe en brazos). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y su bebé que tiene 1 año y ya empieza a caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por pagar los gastos médicos de su bebé la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, tienda de barrio,  servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar con sus negocios. Su actividad es la venta de cosméticos; cada día cargada de un bolso grande lleno de productos recorre todas las ferias y mercados en busca de clientes, estos se encuentran en sus locales comerciales, oficinas, tiendas, etc. Su jornada comienza muy temprano por la mañana y termina muy tarde por la noche, “no existe horario para la venta y los clientes se encuentran a toda hora...” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de trabajo para abastecer su negocio de mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda donde pueda exhibir y vender sus cosméticos para dejar de ambular porque su bolsón pesa mucho, Ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería por mayor, para aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener un stock más variado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marioly solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos médicos de su bebe.
texts.en:
Marioly is a young woman of 19 years of age. She lives with her partner and has a one year old baby. Her business is to give manicures and sell cosmetics. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, patient, a good listener, caring, responsible and very hardworking. Her business is in the South zone of the city, characterized by having many ecological parks, plazas, and multi-sport fields. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with temperatures that vary throughout the day between 21-35 degrees celsius. 

Marioly has a dark complexion, brown eyes, is of medium height, and has long black hair, which she keeps tied back. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish outside of the home and in her business. In the photo she is the one holding a baby. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver and her one year old baby, who is beginning to walk. They live in a rented room made from cement and bricks with a corrugated iron roof. The home has drinkable water, electricity and a sewage system.  

Her need to pay for the medical expenses of her baby led her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as the sale of silverware, the sale of cell phones, the sale of chicken, a neighbourhood store, a tea service and a sewing shop, to request a loan and improve their businesses. 

Her activity is the sale of cosmetics. Everyday she fills a bag with products and goes to all the fairs and markets in search of customers, who she finds in their places of business, offices, stores, etc. Her day begins very early in the morning and ends late at night: "there is no schedule for the sales and customers can be found at all hours" she comments.  The advantage of her business is that she has a portfolio of constant customers. The disadvantage is the lack of work capital to supply her business in the market. Her dream is to open a store where she can exhibit and sell her cosmetics,  in order to stop walking as her bag is very heavy. 

She wishes to buy her merchandise in bulk, to increase her work capital and have a greater variety of products. This is the second loan with the institution in three years for the development of her business. It is for this reason that Marioly is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics in bulk and to use the revenue to pay for the medical expenses of her baby.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk and pay for her baby's medical expenses with the revenue.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 40 years old and lives in Vazashen frontier village of Tavush region. Artur lives in this nice village with his wife, children, and with his mother. All the family is engaged in farming, which is the only source of income for living.

Artur has pigs, piglets, and chickens on his farm. He sells very fresh and tasty pork, for which he has his regular customers. Artur is also good in agricultural activities; on his plot of land he plants beans and fruit trees such apple, pear, fig, and persimmon trees. All these goods go both for sale and for his family’s use.

Artur greatly wants to develop his swine breeding on his farm, since pork sale is greatly profitable. He asks for this Kiva loan, as he wants to buy a lot of fodder for his piglets; he wants to feed them well and prepare them for sale.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his piglets; he wants to feed them well and prepare them for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her three children who are still studying. Her husband works in the Lebanese army and he is the main income source in the family for them to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to request more Kiva loans to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus is a pedagogue and for 16 years has worked at the school as a teacher of physics. As she says she likes her specialty very much and does it with great responsibility and patience, all her pupils like this subject very much thanks to her interesting manner of explaining each lesson. Arus feels this and she wants to make her lessons more attractive thanks to the Kiva partnership and a Kiva loan. 

Arus is married and she has a nice daughter. She lives in Varser village in the Gegharkunik region with her family. Her husband works as a mechanic. She needs this loan of 600,000 AMD to purchase a computer and some new professional literature. She needs these for self-development and they will be very helpful in her teaching activities.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and some new professional literature

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mueke

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mueke, married and lives with her husband. She has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise and financial management. 
She is applying for a Kiva loan to boost her basketry enterprise by buying more weaving materials such as sisal fiber and weaving thread. She is positive that this will enable her weave more baskets thus more income that she hopes to use in ensuring food security.
Mueke is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: To buy weaving materials such as sisal fiber and weaving thread that will help boost the basketry enterprise thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 56 year old, married with 5 children having two attending school, she does cattle fattening and retail shop as her major source of income. She has done these businesses for over 20 years. Winnie applied for a loan of UGX4,000,000 to add capital in her retail shop and buy farm inputs to increase on her farm production and increase sales from retail business. 

She wants to buy posho, rice, sugar for retail business and buying another two cows for her farm to increase milk production. Winnie hopes to increase her income and improves her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, rice, sugar, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene  53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores y el menor de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Nelly es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ayudarle a  su marido a solventar  los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes  cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella les vende a los compañeros de su marido que son  pescadores como él, ella les a deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene más de  15 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante. Ella agradece los créditos y a quienes hacen posible que ella pueda recibir el dinero.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, shores, blusas entre otras prendas. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 loan group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo district, which is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coasts of this beautiful place. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and work in jobs of the sea. 

Nelly lives in this place. She is 53 years old and is in a free union relationship. From this relationship she has three children, two are adults and the youngest is 17 years old. He is in highschool and lives at home. Her partner is a fisherman. 

Nelly is a very hardworking woman, and in order to help her partner to cover the expenses of the home, she works selling clothing of all types. Her form of selling is to go door to door and she also sells from her home where her customers come when they need some article of clothing. She sells to her partner's colleagues, who are fishermen like him. She allows them to use credit and collects every eight days. She has worked selling clothing for over 15 years and this has allowed her to come out ahead. She is grateful for the loans and to those who make it possible for her to receive the money. 
The loan will be used to buy pants, shorts, shirts and other articles of clothing. She is the founder of the loan group and she enjoys it as that is how she started her business. 

Her dream is that her son will become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, shirts and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase on the genge stock and to buy sacks of charcoal to serve more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and farm input for use in the farm for high harvest

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
JUMA who is in his early 40s is married with two children who are still in school.  He has been running a genge business for twenty years now.  He works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be JUMA's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing this genge stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school, loan repayment and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in his genge.  He dreams of being an international business man. 

Juma will share this loan with his loan group Mpunbga which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To restock the out of stock items in his gange.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fortified fertilizer for increased production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits to sell so as to earn additional income

loans.name: Fahrad

texts.en:
Fahrad is 34 years old. With his wife and two children, he lives in the village of Varser in Gegharkunik region. Fahrad mentions that he is happy with his family on his nice and cute farm, which gives his family some income for life needs and also fresh products for his children.

On his farm, Fahrad has a cow, a pig, a bee family, and also sheep and lambs. He also plants some vegetables on his small plot of land; he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots, and greens. All these goods, along with his farm milk, cheese, and meat, he sells with the help of his nice wife at the city’s wholesale market. Fahrad also sells very little honey, since his beekeeping skills and knowledge of that occupation are still very little.

Instead, he considers his land cultivation activities very profitable and hopes that with this partnership with Kiva, he manages to develop it more. With this loan, he wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, and also diesel fuel for his land cultivation work.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, and also diesel fuel for his land cultivation work.

loans.name: Linie

texts.en:
Linie is married with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old, and seven of her children are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Linie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aún viven en su casa uno estudia en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene bazar / papelería y centro de informática, ofrece servicio de internet, copiadora entre otras cosas, actualmente ha estado muy ocupada vendiendo útiles escolares y para esto es la mayor parte del crédito ya que necesita varios útiles para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan. Ella también tiene un bar en el cual con la ayuda de otra persona vende bocadillos, jugos y batidos de frutas, aunque es un poco cansado estar en ambas actividades le gusta este ritmo de trabajo ya que así se gana la vida por el bien  de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar útiles escolares y artículos de bazar que necesita. Ella está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.  Sus sueños son seguir mejorando cada vez más.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Honduras 2000 meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for the pretty beaches which bathe the beaches of this beautiful place. The majority of workers here are hardworking and dedicate themselves to jobs with the sea.  

This is where 56 year old Maria lives.  She is married and has 7 adult children from her relationship, 3 of whom still live in her house.  One studies in the university.  Her husband makes a living fishing.  

Mrs. Maria is a woman who has always liked to work and help with the household costs.  She has a stationary store and information center.  She offers internet and copying services, among others.  Lately she has been very busy selling school supplies and this is what the majority of her loan is for, as she needs various supplies that her clients need.  She also has a bar where, with the help of another person, she sells snacks, juices, and fruit shakes.  Although she is a bit tired of doing both activities, she like the rhythm of the work and in this way is able to earn a living for the well-being of her family.  

She will use this loan to buy school supplies and items for her paper store.  She has been in the credit group since its inception and likes it for the assistance that the loans provide.  Her dream is to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stationary items.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more computer units needed in her business. It was indeed a milestone for her, most especially that she was able to provide a better income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for the same reason. She would use this to maintain her computer shop and, at the same time, add more PC units in her current inventory. She hopes that your hearts will be touched and your support will be with her in her aim to be better.

Epifania hopes that her business will just continue to expand, and she just wants to have good health for her household. She meets up with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her computer shop and, at the same time, add more PC units in her current inventory.

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, ella tiene  30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 1 año de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella hace mas de 4 años y con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del grupo surtió una tienda de víveres en casa de su mamá que es donde ellos viven, allí vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, etc. Ella utiliza cada crédito para ir comprando mayor variedad de productos ya que así gana más clientela cada día, esta vez espera comprar además de vivieres útiles escolares ya que esto se vende mucho en esta época del año, espera con esto tener mejores ganancias que le sirvan para ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y útiles escolares. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio el cual les ayuda a salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener su casa propia y un local.
texts.en:
