The Honduras 2000 loan group meets every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo, which is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coasts of this beautiful place. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and work in jobs of the sea.  
Carmen lives here and she is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, 11, 7 and 1 year old. The older two study in school. Her husband is a fisherman.  
Carmen is a very hardworking woman who likes to work for the good of her family. More than four years ago, and with the help of the first loan that she received from the group, she stocked a general store in her mother's house where they live. From there she sells basic supplies such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, meat, etc. 
She uses each loan to buy a greater variety of products and in this way increase her clientele everyday. This time she hopes to buy more school supplies as she has already sold many in this season of the year. She hopes with this that she will be able to increase her income, which will allow her to improve her life and that of her family. 
This loan will be used to better stock her store, to buy provisions and school supplies. She has been in the loan group for 4 years and she enjoys it because it helped her to open her business and it has helped her to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own home and a location for her store.

loans.use: to buy provisions and school supplies.

loans.name: Norma Ameira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene  68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos mayores e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por la edad. 
Doña Norma  y su marido tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como granos, carnes, lácteos,  detergentes, legumbres, carnes, helados y muchos otros productos para sus clientes que a diario visitan su local, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, este negocio lo comenzaron con unos ahorros que tenían y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación. De esta forma ella y su marido se ganan la vida honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda y comprar víveres de toda clase. Es socia fundadora del  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es tener buena salud y mejorar su negocio
texts.en:
The Credit Group Honduras 2000 meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for the pretty beaches that bathe the coast of this beautiful place.  The majority of inhabitants here are hard-working and make a living off the sea.  This is where 68 year old Norma lives.  She is married and has 7 adult, independent children.  Her husband no longer works because of his age.   

Norma and her husband have a food store in their house.  They sell all types of daily necessity products such as grains, meats, dairy, detergents, legumes, ice creams and other products so that their clients visit their store daily.  They work every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes later.  They started the business with savings and with the help of a loan, for which they are very grateful to the foundation. In this way they make an honorable living. 

They will use this loan to stock the store and buy all types of food products.  She is a founding member of the Credit Group and likes it because with the loan she is able to start her business.  Her dream is to have good health and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: María Melida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, productos de bazar, ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y papelería entre otras cosas, en esta época del año lo que más está vendiendo son útiles escolares y es para lo cual necesita este crédito, trabaja todos los días casi todo el día, ella en su negocio se entretiene con sus amistades y conocidos que llegan todos los días  hasta su local,  tiene su negocio más de 10 años con el cual ella sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres y útiles escolares. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio que le permite ganarse la vida. Su sueño es ir mejorando cada
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo district. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coasts of this lovely area. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and work in jobs of the sea. 
María, who is 45 years old, lives in this place. She is married, and from this relationship she has four children. Three are grown, and the youngest, age 15, is in high-school. Her husband works as a fisherman.
María is a very hardworking woman that takes great effort to get ahead. She has a general store in her home where she sells products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, bazaar-type products, all kinds of clothing, shoes and paper among other things. In this season of the year, what she sells the most of is school supplies. It is for this that she needs this loan. 
She works everyday, for almost the whole day and while working in her business, she enjoys talking to friends and acquaintances who stop by her store each day. She has had her business for almost 10 years and this has helped her to get ahead. 
Her dream is to improve her business more everyday.

loans.use: to buy provisions and school supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Thanks for your unfailing support to Rowena. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to accomplish buying more supplies of merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed helped with the household's basic expenses and helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she had started, she would like to request another 15,000 PHP that she would use to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Luisa's dream of expanding her business and giving her family a better life. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 10 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Guiniales.

Manuel con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como conserje en una institución pública, él tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Manuel ahora tiene una necesidad de comprar un terreno pero lamentablemente él no cuenta con dinero suficiente por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar su terreno que tanta falta le hace a su familia.
El gran sueño de Manuel  es que sus hijos estudien y que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 55 year old man who is married and has a beautiful family of 4 children between 10 and 19 years of age.  This humble family lives in the community go Guiniales.   Manuel, eager to obtain an income and move his family ahead, works as a custodian at a public institution.  He has been doing this for 5 years.  

Manuel now has a need to buy a piece of land, but unfortunately he doesn't have sufficient money.  For this reason he is requesting a loan to be able to buy the land that his family needs.   Manuel's great dream is that this children will study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza. 
 La Sra. Myrian, es una  las integrantes quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que vende de manera ambulante, y con los medios que obtiene ayuda a su familia, dándoles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella comenta que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con su negocio, luchando por el día a día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa group is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program.  They are in the elimination of poverty program in which all put their greatest effort in order to rise above their impoverished situation.
Myrian is one of the members who makes a living selling various types of articles of clothing which she sells itinerantly, and with the means that she obtains, she helps her family, giving them a worthy life without privations.  She says that she is putting in her all in order to be able to grow and get ahead.
She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase various articles of clothing for sale, and with this to be able to continue with her business, struggling from day to day.  She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is thankful that he previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan which he used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for the regular maintenance of his tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He thanks God and you in for your good heart and the financial help that will be extended to him.

Ismael hopes to buy another unit to improve his income and their living condition. Every week he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the  maintenance for his tricycle.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Maximino, a carpenter whose children are already married and raising their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually meet her and her husband's everyday needs.

Josefina has had a steel manufacturing business for 10 years already. She buys steel and makes it into gates, fences, grills, garden sets and windows. She also does body repair of refrigerators. She has established a reputable name in steel products and body repair of refrigerators and is well known in her community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy steel and manufacture the orders of her contractor clients. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Josefina hopes to have more customers even outside their town. She prays for God to bless her business in order to lead a comfortable life in their old age. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To  buy steel to manufacture steel windows, steel gates, steel fences and garden sets.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat lives with his small family in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Azat and his wife used to work as cooks. Now only his wife is in that line of work and Azat has become a farmer.  They have a school-aged son. Azat does his best to provide his family with the best living conditions, but he hardly makes ends meet since he has only a few farm cattle, and the income is small as well. 

On his farm he has cows, a calf, bulls and chickens. Azat sells some milk, cheese, and eggs from his farm, but he is not able to manage the sale of meat that he wants to organize so much. He is sure it would be very profitable for his family. So with this loan he wants to buy calves and sheep for his farm, so that he will be able to start selling fresh and tasty meat to city butchers, who usually give good orders.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep for his farm, so that he will be able to start selling fresh and tasty meat

loans.name: Charito Magaly

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Charito, tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos, tres mayores de edad y cuatro de 16, 14, 8 y 7 años, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad, dos en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es maestro albañil. 
Doña Charito es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos que son muchos  se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella todas las tardes instala un pequeño local afuera del negocio de su hermana, allí ella vende  deliciosas empanadas de plátano con queso, carne o pollo, todos los días tiene muchos clientes que le compran sus alimentos. Ella también tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, esto no le quita mucho tiempo ya que sus hijos le ayudan en la alimentación de los animalitos los mismos que vende en pie o por libras, esto le deja muy buenas ganancias.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos y víveres para preparar las empanadas. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Jaramijo canton which is known for it's beautiful beaches that bath the shores of this beautiful area. The majority of inhabitants are very hard working and dedicated to work at sea.

Charito lives in this place. She is 41 years old, is married and from this relationship has 7 children, three of them adults and the other four are 16, 14, 8 and 7 years old. One of the eldest studies at university, two are in Secondary school and the youngest is in Primary school. Her husband is a master builder.

Charito is a housewife who in order to obtain her own resources to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her numerous children makes and sells meals. Every afternoon she sets up a small stand outside the business of her sister. Here she sells delicious plantain and cheese, meat and chicken empanadas. She has a lot of clients every day who buy her food.

She also has a small chicken coop. This does not make up a lot of her time as her children help her with feeding the animals that she sells live or by weight and she makes a good profit.

The loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens and food to prepare her empanadas. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it as the credits allow her to move forward. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for the chickens and food.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Его зовут Дилмурод. Ему 25 лет. Он скромный и приятный молодой человек. Дилмурод недавно женился и его жизнь перевернулась верх наголову. Он стал более ответственным человеком. Ранее он жил только с мамой и теперь в дом привез невестку. Дилмурод планирует стать отцом и дать ему все что в свое время не смог получить, в том числе образование. Дилмурод не смог получить образование, так как он должен был работать. Дилмурод хочет стать примерным отцом для своих детей. Для этого ему необходимо стать успешным человеком. На сегодняшний день, Дилмурод занимается предоставлением услуги такси на собственной машине. За свои услуги он требует маленькие деньги, соответствующие уровни жизни жителей. Дилмурод сейчас остановил свою деятельность по причине поломки своей машины. Дилмуроду срочно нужно купить запчасти для машины. У него не хватает средств для совершения покупки и у него одна надежда остается на получения кредита. Дилмурод надеется, что его поддержат. Спасибо.
texts.en: Meet Dilmurod, a 25-year-old modest and pleasant young man.  Dilmurod recently got married, which completely changed his life, as he became a very responsible man.  He used to live alone with his mom, but his young wife now lives with them.  Dilmurod is planning to become a father and to give his future children everything that he wasn't able to receive, particularly an education (since he had to work).  He now wants to be a role model for his children and, for this, he needs to be successful.  At the moment, Dilmurod provides taxi services with his own car.  Given the standard of living of his customers, he doesn't charge much for his services.  Unfortunately, he has recently stopped working because his car broke down.  For this reason, Dilmurod, quickly needs to buy spare parts.  However, he doesn't have the resources to make this purchase, so this loan is his only hope.  He hopes to receive some support.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lailani works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock (chickens). 

Lailani has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Lailani is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her  rice farming business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julieta has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Roque está integrado  por  13 mujeres, están en  el 1er  ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan. Se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Maura, quien se dedica a la confección y venta de Sabanas y fundas, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y  por medio de su trabajo y lucha viene mejorando cada día. Maura se destaca en este grupo por ser una persona muy entusiasta y sacrificada.
La Señora Maura Solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos y materiales para la confección de Sabanas y fundas, como ser telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y con ello pode seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is composed of 13 women.  They are in their first cycle of the women's committee program in which all work and help each other.  They are in the elimination of poverty program, struggling to be able to improve every day.
One of the members is Maura who makes a living by sewing and selling sheets and covers.  Through her efforts and continual work and by means of her work and struggling, she is improving every day.  Maura stands out in this group by being a very enthusiastic and sacrificing person.
Maura is requesting this loan in order to purchase supplies and materials for sewing sheets and covers, such as cloth, thread, elastics, and other things, and with this she will be able to continue struggling to improve.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastics, and other things.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 49 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Olivia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming rice and buy-and-sell fruits.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Erma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.  Erma is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past six years.

Catalina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Aleta

texts.en:
Aleta is a 61-year-old widow, and she lives in Kapan City of the Syunik region. Several years ago Aleta lost one of her sons and now she lives alone. Her two children (son and daughter) are already married and they live with their families separately.  

Aleta has a vocational education as an accountant and for many years till today she has worked in her specialty. Now she works as an accountant at the local school. 

This loan Aleta greatly hopes to have, as she plans to do some constructional work on the grave of her son.

loans.use: to do some constructional work on the grave of her son

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Florence works hard to support her family.

Florence has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell ready to wear business. Florence is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Florence has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Yeimi Yohana

texts.es:
Yeimi una mujer luchadora, toda una guerrera de la vida, madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos, la mujer de 15 y el hombre de 7 a los cuales les brindo techo, alimento, educación, ejerció los papales de padre y madre, ella es una empresaria que fundó su negocio le puso mucho empeño y ganas, tiene una fábrica de elaboración y ventas de cama, cuenta con tres empleados, ella se encarga de la administración y es quien busca a los clientes, todo trabajo lo acepta, de verdad una mujer perseverante que tiene muy defino su camino a seguir, el del progreso.

Yeimi quiere mejorar su ventas, está en proceso de ampliar su local para tener mayor espacio para guardar insumos y  productos terminado, de igual manera para poder generar mayor empleo, ella se apoya mucho en los créditos es la manera fácil de conseguir materiales e ir progresando a pasos pequeños pero firmes.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de madera de roble, en cantidades, compra de tornillos y pintura, un apoyo que le ayudara a construir una importante cantidad de camas en este material y cubrir un pedido.

El mayor sueño de Yeimi es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener un auto y conocer el mundo con ellos.
texts.en:
Yeimi is a fighter, a warrior in life. She is the mother and head of family of two children, a 15 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. She provides them with food, shelter, education and plays the role of both father and mother.

She is a businesswoman who founded her business with much effort and desire. She has a business making and selling beds and has 3 employees. She takes care of the administration and she is who looks for clients. She accepts any work she is truly a persevering woman who has a very definite path to follow, that of progress.

Yeimi wants to improve her sales and is in the process of expanding her shop to have more room to keep supplies and finished product. At the same time in order to create more employment she depends a lot of loans which are an easy way of getting material and progress in small but sure steps.

She wants to request a loan to buy oak wood in quantity, and buy screws and paint. This help will allow her to build an important number of beds in this material and fill an order. Yeimi's big dream is to be able to pay for the education of her children. have a car and get to know the world with them.

loans.use: to buy oak wood to make beds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is grateful that she was granted a 22,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

Cecilia would now like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wire and the net she needs for growing healthy and beautiful ornamental plants to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Cecilia dreams to grow her ornamental farm and attract more customers. She prays to God for her family's physical and spiritual strength. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, wire and baskets.

loans.name: Madafu Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her late 40s is married with three children, who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now.  She works from 8 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asha's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe stock and started selling soft drinks; she  paid back her loans successfully.  

Asha used the profit to pay school fees, repay her loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock out of stock items in her food store. She dreams of developing her business.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group  Madafu, which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in her food store.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is an architect with a higher education who, for many years until now, has worked in his specialty. He lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Armen is married and his wife is a doctor who works at the city’s hospital. They have a son and a daughter. Their daughter is a student and, like her mother, in future she will also become a doctor. 

Armen mentions that he is happy that even though he chose the right specialty with architecture, he could never give up his agricultural activities and the skills that his father taught him.  He has a cute vegetable garden where he cultivates beans, cucumbers and potatoes. Armen cares for his planted harvest with great pleasure and very carefully. He is pleased that his family is happy to have dinner made from the potatoes he has grown or supper made from his planted beans. 

Armen needs this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy connections for his garden fence as well as a water tank so he will never have any problem with watering when there isn't other water available.

loans.use: to buy connections for his garden fence as well as a water tank

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past five years.

Estelita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Porfirio Ivan

texts.es:
Porfirio es un hombre de 59 años, una persona independiente, trabajador de calle, un hombre que se la rebusca para mantener su familia, vive con su pareja se dedica a la venta informa de películas en formato DVD, candelas, fósforos, protectores de documentos básicamente, se ubica en una estación del sistema de transporte Metro, aprovechando el flujo de gente que pasa por estos sitios.

Para Porfirio esta actividad ha representado una enorme ayuda en su casa, pues se encontraba sin trabajo, necesita llevar alimento, pagar las deudas y pro su avanzada edad se le dificultaba mucho más emplearse, pero encontró en el emprendimiento una salida a sus problemas y hoy trabaja por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda
texts.en: Porfirio is a 59 year old man. He is an independent person, a street worker who is searching to maintain his family. He lives with his partner. He works informally selling DVD formatted movies, candles, matches and document covers. Basically he sets up in a Metro transport system station taking advantage of the flow of people who pass these places. For Porfirio this business represents a great help for his household as he is without employment and has to bring home food, pay his debts and at his age it will be more difficult to get other employment. But in this enterprise he found a solution to his problem and today works to improve the conditions of his household.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of movies in DVD format, candles. matches and document covers.

loans.name: Ziyoratsho

texts.ru: Это мужчина Зиератшо. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Сын находится на заработках загранице, чтобы заработать на жизнь. Дочка школьница. Зиератшо честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он дехкан. Зиератшо имеет земельный участок, где посадил капусту, кукурузу и картофель. На каждого посева урожая он вкладывает душу. Результаты его трудов можете увидеть на фотографии. Зиератшо хочет отработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный и здоровый урожай. Для купли минеральных удобрений ему нужны деньги. Он просит взаймы, чтобы поскорее приобрести минеральных удобрений и обработать овощи ими. У Зиератшо большой опыт работы и желание трудиться. Он нуждается финансовой поддержке. Помогите его!
texts.en: Meet Ziyoratsho, a married man and the father of two children.  His son is currently making a living abroad.  His daughter is still in school.  Ziyoratsho is an honest and hardworking man.  He is a farmer and works on a mid-sized peasant farm.  He also owns a plot of land where he has planted cabbage, corn and potatoes.  He puts all his soul into every harvest.  You can see the results of his work in the photo.   Ziyoratsho now wants to prepare his land with mineral fertilizers, so that he can get an abundant and healthy harvest.  However he needs money to buy these fertilizers.  He is taking a loan to quickly buy mineral fertilizers and to grow vegetables.  Ziyoratsho is an experienced farmer and he enjoys working hard.  He is hoping to receive some financial support.  Please help him!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and use them to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Omaira Isabel

texts.es:
Omaira es una persona humilde y sencilla de 37 años de edad, madre de tres hijas de 16, 15 y 8 años de edad que hoy viene con una petición para que la ayuden apoyándola con un pequeño capital que ella usara para iniciar su negocio de venta de aves.

Omaira busca el apoyo financiero ya que no cuenta con capital, quiere ser empresaria para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para tener un hogar digno, comer mejor, que sus hijos estudien y escogió la venta de aves porque es una actividad que su esposo le enseño a realizar.

Con el préstamo tiene muchas expectativas, con su empresa metas, como generar empleo y encontrar clientes rápidamente, su mayor problema es la competencia en el sector, que se vuelve una gran ventaja pues las personas buscan mucho la vereda por ser una zona llena de empresas avícolas.

El préstamo Omaira lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para construcción de Galpones (madera, cercas y tejas), compra de pollos y alimento de pollos.
texts.en:
Omaira is a humble and simple person who is 37 years old, and mother of three daughters aged 16, 15, and 8 years old. Today she comes with a request for help and support with a small loan that she will use to start a business selling poultry.

Omaira is looking for financial help since she has no capital. She wants to be an entrepreneur to improve her living conditions, to have a decent home, eat better, and that her children study. She chose the sale of poultry because it is an activity that her husband taught her to do.

With this loan she has many expectations and goals, like generating employment and finding customers quickly. Her biggest difficulty is competition in the area, which can also be an advantage because people come to the area known for its many poultry companies.

Omaira will invest this loan in the purchase of materials for construction of barns (wood, fences, and shingles) and to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction of barns (wood, fences, and shingles) and purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
A sus 70 años de edad  Carlos están con todos los ánimos y ganas de montar un negocio, él vive solo se separó de su esposa, arrendo una casa y ahora necesita dinero para mantenerse, por ello quiere empezar una venta de alimento y quiera que lo acompañes en este proyecto, nunca se es viejo para ser emprendedor.

Con el dinero que se encuentra solicitando Carlos quiere comprar carro de comidas, compra de sillas, materia prima para realizar las preparaciones como perros, hamburguesas, papas fritas, carnes asada, comprar una pipeta de gas, manteles, cubiertos, platos desechables, servilletas utensilios entre otros.

Este préstamo serviría para que un adulto mayor tenga un medio de sostenimiento y espera en un futuro tener salud y generar empleo.
texts.en:
At 70 years of age, Carlos has all the spirit and desire to begin a business.  He lives alone; he separated from his wife.  He rents a house and now he needs money to maintain himself.  For this reason, he wants to begin with food sales and he wants you to join him in the project.  One is never too old to be enterprising.
With the money that he finds himself requesting, Carlos wants to buy a food cart; chairs; raw materials to make his preparations such as hotdogs, hamburgers, French fries, and grilled meat; a gas cylinder; table clothes; silverware; disposable plates; napkins; and utensils amongst other things.
This loan would be used by an older adult to have a means of sustenance and who hopes in the future to have health and generate employment.

loans.use: to buy a food cart, chairs, gas cylinder, table clothes, silverware, disposable plates, napkins, and utensils amongst other things.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 42 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional supplies like soft drinks, sardines, and noodles to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Ma. Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like soft drinks, sardines, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон молодой житель района Чиликул. Он предоставляет услуги такси. Илхомчон перевозит людей из одной точки районо на другую. Он кроме такси еще занимается растениеводством, и растениеводство является основной деятельностью, потому что доход от этой деятельности обеспечить его семью. Работа таксиста не постоянная и не перспективная, поэтому Илхомчон больше время проводить на земельный участок. Он не боится трудиться и всегда идет вперед. Каждый год Илхомчон сажает урожай, и сейчас он закончил посев и ему надо обработать земля минеральными удобрениями. Но у него нет денежных средство для купли минеральных удобрений, и по этой причине он просит кредит. Илхомчон в будущем планирует расширить землю.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is a young resident of the Jilikul district who provides taxi services.  He takes his customers from one end of the district to the other.  In addition to his work as a taxi driver, he is involved in agriculture.  Agriculture is in fact his main activity because the income he derives from it helps provide for his family.  The job of a taxi driver is not constant and not promising, so for this reason, Ilhomjon spends more time working on his land.  

Ilhomjon is not afraid of working hard and he is always moving forward.  He plants crops annually.  He just finished planting toward the next harvest and he now needs to add mineral fertilizers to his soil.  However, he doesn't have the financial resources to buy mineral fertilizers, which is the reason why he is taking this loan.  In the future, he would like to expand his activity and have more land.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old and she lives with her husband and two school-aged sons in the Geghanush village of Syunik region. She has vocational training as a nurse, but she never worked in the field. She worked as a saleswoman for several years but now she is very busy on her farm with her beehives. 

Anna is a skilled beekeeper and she manages to produce very tasty and healing honey. For her farm’s honey, she has long list of regular customers. She also has cows and chickens on her farm and she sells milk, meat and eggs from her farm. Anna’s husband works as a locksmith but he manages also to help his wife about the farm. Anna is happy that she found Kiva and Nor Horizon's supportive program and she also hopes also to be supported. She needs this loan in order to purchase new special tools for upcoming honey squeezing activities.

loans.use: to purchase new special tools for honey squeezing activities.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik lives in Spitak city which is in the Lori region. Arpik is a widow; in 1988 her husband died because of a horrible earthquake that destroyed many families, and Arpik’s family also was one of the thousands in the earthquake that day. Arpik’s single daughter is married, and she lives with her family. 

Arpik has pedagogical education and her specialty is teaching elementary classes and methodology. Arpik has 30 years of work experience and now also works at the city school as a teacher of elementary classes. She also has a group of pupils whom at her house she helps to get prepared for their homework and she also helps them to overcome hardships that some of them have in their learning process. 

She will use this loan for the purchase of a computer and professional literature so she can make her private courses more interesting and informative for her pupils.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and professional literature

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fertilized duck eggs in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more duck eggs for her business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more duck eggs for her business

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jeremy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from goat fattening. Jeremy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jeremy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eleven children.

She runs a buy-and-sell veterinary products business in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bottles of veterinary products to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including a general store.

Lilita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles of veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David es un joven de 23 años de edad una persona humilde y de un excelente corazón que inicio su negocio de Barbería y lo empezó con un deseo algo humilde pero que sale de su alama el cual es ayudar a su madre, la persona que le dio la vida y pro quien está dispuesto a darlo todo.

Juan David en su barbería genera un empleo, la temática jamaiquina usada en su establecimiento ha gustado mucho y atrae muchos clientes, por ello quiere realizar una inversión para adecuar todo sui negocio con un tema jaimaquino.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo Juan David quiere pintar su negocio, construir un tocador, adornarlo, poner luces led, para su negocio, solo espera que este negocio le genere buena utilidad y en algún momento de su vida darle una casa a su madre.
texts.en:
Juan David, 23, is a humble person with an excellent heart who started a barbershop business, and he started it with a somewhat humble wish, but which came from his heart, which was to help his mother, the person who gave him life and to whom he is willing to give everything.
Juan David generates employment for one employee.  The Jamaican theme of his establishment is very pleasing and attracts lots of customers.  For this reason, he wants to invest in it to complete the whole business with a Jamaican theme.
With the help of a loan, Juan David wants to paint his business, construct a dressing table, decorate it, and put up LED lights.  For his business, he only wishes that the business generate good profitability and at some moment in his life to give his mother a house.

loans.use: to paint his business, construct a dressing table, decorate it, and put up LED lights.

loans.name: Bibimaryam

texts.ru:
Бибимарям 25 лет. Она не замужняя девушка, и живет вместе родителям.  Бибимарям  2 года своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность, чтобы не сидеть дома без дел, и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама работала именно в этой сфере деятельности. И мама научила ее правильно вести торговую деятельность.
   Бибимарям продает огурцы, помидоры, бананы и яблоко. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Бибимарям надеется с увеличением товара, увеличится доход. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibimaryam is 25 years old.  She is single and still lives with her parents.  She has been involved in small retail business for the past two years of her life.  Thanks to this activity, she has something to do and she also helps her parents to provide for the family.  She decided to get involved in this type of business because her mother already worked in the same field and was able to properly teach her how to run a small retail business.

Bibimaryam sells cucumbers, tomatoes, bananas and apples.  She has decided to increase her activity and inventory.  With more produce to sell, Bibimaryam is hoping to increase her income.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and increase her sales.

loans.name: Grayik

texts.en: Grayik is a farmer and he lives with his family in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. He has three sons and a pretty daughter who is five years old. Grayik’s sons are grown up and they perfectly help their father about the farm. Grayik’s farm cattle are cows, a calf, a heifer, bulls and chickens. As Grayik mentions, the sale of milk, cheese and eggs from his farm makes part of his family income but meat sales are the most profitable among all of them. He usually takes orders from the city butchers and during the week two or three times he sells his meat wholesale. Grayik would also like to enlarge the assortment of dairy products, since if they have enough milk from their cattle his wife could make more cheese and also macun (a national dairy product) and curd to sell from his farm. With this Kiva loan he wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen, from Varser village of the Gegharkunik region, was greatly sure that his partnership with Kiva lenders would be long and profitable and now he is waiting for one more deal. Arsen is married and he has three children. It has been many years that only through farming and its income that Arsen has provided for his family's living. He has a rich farm where he takes care of cows, heifer, calves, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. He also cultivates potatoes on his plot of land and it is of a very good sort that is of great demand among his customers and they are sold very quickly. This season Arsen also wants to plant that sort of potatoes and he will use this loan to purchase potato seedlings and fertilizer for his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings and fertilizer for his agricultural activities.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre soltero de 28 años de edad que tiene una fábrica de Bolsas plásticas, inicio el negocio con la ambición de comprar una vivienda propia, lleva 5 años de recorrido en el cual ha logrado sobrevivir ante la fuerte competencia y ha generado dos empleos.

Sebastián tiene volumen de trabajo, pero su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital para crecer y abarcar pedidos más grandes, tiene la maquinaria, pero no el material para producir, y ya que sus clientes pagan contra pedido y solo puede prestar hasta cierto tope con su proveedores muchas veces tiene que negarse a realizar un trabajo.

Por tal motivo Sebastián quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de su insumo principal que es Hoja de capa y pago a proveedores, este préstamo le permitirá crecer su fondo propio y así iniciar a sacar más producción que a la larga significa un aumento en ventas y utilidad.
texts.en: Sebastián is a single, 28 year old man that has a plastic bag factory. He began the business with the ambition of buying his own home. He has been around for 5 years, in which he has managed to survive against the strong competition and has gained two employees. Sebastián has the work volume but his main inconvenience is lack of money to grow and cover larger orders. He has the machinery but not the material to produce, and since his clients pay upon request and he can only loan until a certain point with his suppliers, many times he has to refuse a job. For this reason, Sebastián wants to ask for a loan to buy his main material, which are layered sheets, and to pay his suppliers. This loan will allow him to grow his own personal funds and thus begin to get more production that in the long run will mean an increase in sales and utility.

loans.use: to buy layered sheets to make plastic bags.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоилу 56 лет. Он проживает в Кубадиён. Исмоил глава большого семейства. Он муж, брат, отец и дедушка. Исмоил занимается животноводством уже долгое время. Исмоил принял бизнес своих предков. Почти все жители района занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, так как и другой работы очень мало. Поэтому многие мужчины находятся на заработках. Исмоилу в свое время мог тоже уехать, но он выбрал остаться со своей семьей. Сейчас Исмоил активно продвигает свой бизнес и хочет добиться признаний своей области. Причина обращения за кредитом со стороны Исмоилчона является увеличения поголовья скотов. Его сбережения не позволяют ей приобрести не обходимое количество скот, и он принял решения полагаться на заемные средства.
texts.en: Ismoil is 56 years old and lives in Qubadiyon.  He is at the head of a large family.  He is a husband, a brother, a father and a grandfather.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for a long time already, as he took over his ancestors' business.  Almost all the residents of this particular district of Tajikistan are involved in agriculture, because there are very few other jobs.  For this reason also, many men have left the country to make a living abroad.  Ismoil had the opportunity to leave at some point, but he chose to stay with his family.  Today, he's actively running his business and he wants to achieve some recognition in his region.  He is taking a loan to increase his livestock headcount.  His savings are not enough to allow him to purchase the number of animals that he needs, so he decided to rely on borrowed funds.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
The city of Bacolod in Negros Occidental is one of the areas affected by Typhoon Haiyan, that devastated the Philippines in November, 2013. Marivic and her family were lucky to survive the harsh calamity with the grace of God. Marivic is a vegetable vendor, and there was a time after the typhoon that her business suffered a lot due to damaged farmlands, trees and crops. With the help of her husband Claro, an ordinary employee, and their three children, they were able to “build back better” her vegetable vending business. Now she’s aiming to add more vegetable produce and buy a coconut grinder that will easily attract buyers of coconut because they won’t have to grind the coconut manually. It will surely increase her daily income and enhance her savings. In order to attain this, she’s requesting PHP 22,000.

Additional income and savings from this loan will make her business more stable and improve their house, which has gradually deteriorated due to numerous typhoons. Ultimately, she wants to fulfill her dream that all her children will finish college. Marivic and her husband know that education is the most prized inheritance that they can give their children. Praying that you will be an instrument in attaining all of Marivic’s dreams.

Marivic meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a coconut grinder and additional vegetable produce.

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro is 49 years old and lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. Saro is married and has three children. His daughters are students, and his son is unemployed and is looking for some job.

Saro is a farmer, and with his wife he takes care of his farm cattle, which is a lot and demands great expenses and effort. On his farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, pigs, sheep, and chickens. Saro sells a great range of farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd, meat, and eggs. From land cultivation he also has some profit, as he sells potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and peppers.

He organizes the sale of his entire farm products at the city wholesale market every day. Like many farmers, Saro also hopes to have more profit from meat selling, especially from the sale of pork. So, with this loan he wants to buy two more pigs for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more pigs for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. Muhammad works in the private sector where he gets an unstable income. This income is barely enough to assist with all the family needs.

Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system to heat water for the family house. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity to save money.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to heat water for the family house.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en: Yervand is 50 years old and lives with his wife in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. He has two sons. The elder one is temporarily in the Russian Federation working there and his younger son is in the army now, while Yervand and his wife are busy with farming. On the farm Yervand has cows, calves, pigs and chickens. He sells his farm products to his neighbors and customers from the city. He sells very tasty milk and cheese, fresh meat and very good eggs. He will be very happy and thankful if Kiva lenders will help him with the loan amount he wants to enlarge the number of his farm cattle. He will buy a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle in order to enlarge the number of his farm cattle

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 34 years old, and he lives in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkinuk region with his wife, two nice daughters and his retired father. 

Ara combines his construction work with his farming, which is the main source of income for his family. His farm is a small one and here he has cows, calves, a heifer and piglets. He sells a little milk and also some meat from his farm to his regular customers. 

Ara just dreams of a bigger farm which is richer with cattle, but since he does not have enough finances, he cannot make it true. 

If Ara manages to receive this Kiva loan, he will buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle. In this way, Ara’s wife will make various dairy-products and sell them from their farm. They may also be receiving more income than they manage to now.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 pieces cotton material for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale by her husband.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora, Zoila tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos dos son mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 12 años que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Zoila con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de    repuestos de motos, ropa y productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días de Lunes a Sábados de 8h00 a 12h00 vendiendo los repuestos con la ayuda de su hija y en las tardes se dedica a la venta de los productos de catálogos ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace cinco años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa. Está en el grupo de crédito hace 14 años, su sueño es que su negocio crezca y seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en: The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and visited spa in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is the first deepwater port of Ecuador and South America. Zoila, who is 48 years old, lives here. She is married and has 3 children. Two are independent adults and one is 12 years old and goes to high school. Her husband is a chauffeur. In order to have her own income, Zoila makes a living selling motorcycle parts, clothing and products from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works every day from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. selling the parts with the help of her daughter, and she dedicates the afternoons to selling the catalog products since it is easier for her to make her rounds during this time. Her sales form is going door-to-door. She leaves a credit and collects them weekly. She loves to sell and has been doing it for five years, which have gone really well for her since she has a big clientele. Her best-sellers are the cosmetics and the perfumes. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, imitation jewelry, cosmetics, lotions and clothing. She has been in this loan group for 14 years. Her dream is that her business grows and she continues helping her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, imitation jewelry, cosmetics, lotions and clothing.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: This young man is 27 year-old Karen. He lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region with his parents, brother and his wife. All of the family is engaged in farming and potato cultivation. Karen takes care of cows, calves, bulls, sheep, pigs and chickens. Karen’s mother greatly helps sell farm products. She makes and sells very testy macun (national dairy-product), cheese and curd. Karen sells meat and harvests potatoes. He works very hard and overcomes many difficulties with the one hope that little by little he will make his farm richer with cattle and more profitable. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks in order to buy calves for his farm and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves for his farm and fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik is a farmer who was born in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife and their single son. His farm is not a big one and it hardly covers the first needs of the family. Here he has cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. Gagik manages the sale of milk, meat and eggs with the help of his beloved wife. His son also helps his parents about the farm and he perfectly finds customers for their farm products. Gagik will use this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of a calf and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en: Gnel, his wife and two pretty daughters live in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. His elder daughter is a student and the youngest is still school-aged. Gnel’s wife is unemployed and she greatly helps her husband about their farm. This farm is very important for the family since besides its income for their everyday needs it also helps to pay for the education of Gnel’s elder daughter. On his farm Gnel has cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. The sale of his farm milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs brings a very cute income so every financial need is covered carefully and with some savings for Gnel’s family. This loan will help Gnel to enlarge his farm with one more calf and he will also buy fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more calf and he will also buy fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase one bundle of slippers for her shoe sale business

loans.name: Mazingira Group

texts.en:
Masha is in her early 40s and married with three children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for fifteen years. She works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Masha's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit for school fees, loan repayment, savings and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of owning a cafeteria.

Masha will share this loan with her loan group Mazingira which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in her food stall

loans.name: Maria Edilma

texts.es:
María Edilma es una mujer de 53 años de edad, ella durante 12 años se ha dedicado a la venta de alimento como pandequesos, buñuelos, pasteles, papas rellenas, una actividad que inicio pro necesidad económica para contrarrestar las adversidades y necesidades que pasaban en su hogar.

Gracias a este negocio María empezó a generar calidad en su familia, primero mejoro la alimentación, conforme pasaba el tiempo veía que podía pagar algunas deudas y así poco a poco fue equilibrando la situación económica en su casa.

María pro la experiencia ha ganado varios clientes, la mayor satisfacción para ella es ver que vende todos los productos, pero algunos de sus clientes se quedan si su “frito” para el desayuno, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una fritadora y surtido de alimentos congelados, para aumentar su producción y por ende generar más ventas.
texts.en:
María Edilma is a 53 year old woman. For 12 years she has made a living selling food like pandequesos (cheese breads), buñuelos (cheese fritters), pasteles (a tamale-like food usually made with rice), and papas rellenas (stuffed potatoes). She started this business due to economic necessity in order to counteract the adversities and needs in her home. 

Thanks to this business, María started to bring about quality in her family. First their diet improved and as time passed, she saw that she could repay some debts so the economic situation in her home began to balance itself out little by little. 

María has gained several customers through the experience. Her greatest satisfaction is seeing that she sells all the products, but some of her customers are left without her "frito" (deep fried snack) for breakfast and this is why she wants to request a loan to buy a fryer and an assortment of frozen foods to increase her production and therefore generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy a fryer and an assortment of frozen foods to increase her production and therefore generate more sales.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and three aged school children. She is a housewife and her husband works in a local company to satisfy the family needs, and to enable them to live a good lifestyle. 

Today, in order to pay her children's end of school year fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the school fees and ensure the appropriate education for their children.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Fawzieh

texts.en:
Fawzieh is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her three children, who are all still studying. Her husband owns a ranch and he is the main income source in the family that is able to enhance their way of living. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 33-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, both of whom are attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time.  Her husband is the main income provider in the family, he works as a farmer to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. 

Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to register them at school. The parents only wish is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to register her children at school.

loans.name: Julian Andres

texts.es:
Julián un hombre de 29 años de edad que debido a una necesidad económica y a falta de oportunidades de empleo decidió empezar una vida como empresario montando un negocio de tienda general donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar.

Debido a un problema de orden público a nivel nacional los camioneros encargados de llevar la mercancía a los diferentes rincones de Colombia, entraron a paro indefinido, generan una problemática nacional donde escaseaban los alimentos, por ende el precio para abastecer se elevó.

Julián vive de su tienda, el mantiene un hogar que lo conforma su pareja y mantiene a sus padres, necesita surtido para abastecer a su tienda pero este está más costoso por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de abarrotes, granos, vegetales, el motivo del monto del préstamo obedece al alza de precios pro la problemática anteriormente mencionada.
texts.en:
Julián is a 29-year-old man who, due to economic necessity and the lack of work opportunities, decided to start a life as a business owner. He started a general store where he offers basic family necessities.

Because of a problem from a national public order, the truck drivers in charge of carrying the merchandise to all corners of Colombia began an indefinite strike. This caused a national problem in which foods became scarce; therefore, the price to stock a business increased.

Julián lives off of his store. He maintains a home with his partner and maintains his parents. He needs merchandise to stock his store, but this is more expensive. Therefore, he wants to request a loan that he wants to invest in the purchase of groceries, grains, and vegetables. The motivation for the loan is the rise in prices because of the problem previously mentioned.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of blood syrup and antibiotics like ampiclox.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 51-year-old widow living with her husband and three children. She is a housewife and her husband works selling clothing and, in parallel, works as an employee at a local school. Today, in order to pay her son's university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay her son's university fees and enable him to pursue his education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her son's university fees

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. He husband owns a car parts shop to be able to improve their family’s way of living and meet the requirements of life. Today, she is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees to be able to register them in the new school year, which makes her a very happy and optimistic person.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Favour Group

texts.en: Ndaona, a widow, is 36 years old with five children. Ndaona supports her family with the earnings she gets from selling doughnuts. She will use the loan obtained to buy yeast, sugar, cooking oil and salt in order to increase her supply of doughnuts for the market. She plans to build a house and a shop. She hopes to live a better life and send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely works hard to support her family. Emely is married and has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emely has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has two children five years old and six months old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him for his schooling. In 2008, Ibrahim established his electrical appliance business. He began his business because he chose it as his occupation. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are men. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ibrahim now requires a new loan in order to buy plasmas, DVDs, freezers, etc. for resale. He hopes that this loan will help to add stock and maximize profit. In the future, he would like to travel to buy his stock instead of buying from wholesalers. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plasmas, DVDs, freezers, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in a rural area called Nyabihoko. She is 26 years old married with two children. She deals in coffee and took a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to assist her in improving her coffee plantation. She also has a bar as a side income. Her challenge is that she is the breadwinner at home and therefore has little money left to re-invest in the business. She hopes to construct a permanent house for her family since her husband has nothing that he does.
She will use the money to buy organic fertilizers to spread on her coffee plantations so that she can boost her yields.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Old School Group

texts.en:
Bintu is a 42-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of the Old School solidarity group. Old School solidarity group has four members who are all women.  Bintu sells foodstuff like beans, rice, onions, etc. Bintu has been in this foodstuff business for the past 10 years. She opens her business six days a week from 9am to 6pm. (In the group picture, Bintu stands at the extreme left.)

Bintu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees and provides food with the profit she gets from her business. Bintu and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Bintu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. She will use her portion to buy bags of beans, onions, rice, etc. for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Bintu is married and has five children who are 22, 19, 16, 3 and 1 years old. They are all school-going children, except the last one.

In the future, Bintu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes that educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Bintu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, onions, and rice for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more items for the grocery store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is married and she has two sons. She pays rent and she is a baker. Her husband drives a car and the family gets extra money with that activity. Raquel needs a loan to buy flour, butter and other inputs to make pastries. She is convinced she can make more money with her products. Raquel hopes you can help her. She would like to have a big bakery in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and other inputs to make pastries

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en: Jhonny is married and he has two kids. He is living at his parents-in-law's house. Jhonny is a bus driver and his wife takes care of a library at the house where the family is living. Jhonny needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. He hopes you can help him. He works hard and he is healthy.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has children who are in school.

Flocerfida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Flocerfida has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Musoma Pineaple Grp Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her mid-40s, is single with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a retail shop for three years now.  She works from 7am to 6:30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly report.  

This will be Zainabu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her shop inventory and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, repay her loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her shop inventory and meet her customers' demands. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group Musoma Pineaple Grp, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase shop inventory and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing materials

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda is a happy married woman and she has her own house. She works as an executive assistant at one Bolivian school and her husband is a retired teacher. Amanda needs a loan to repair a wall at her house and to change the roof. She works hard. She is healthy and the money her husband has is not enough to pay for good work and that is why she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to repair a wall at her house and to change the roof

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is from a rural area in Nyambaga, Kanoni Kiruhura.  He took a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy cattle for fattening and reselling. This process takes minimum of 3 months.

He will repay the loan on a quarterly basis. Now that he will get access to the UGAFODE loan facility, he will expand the business. He appreciates the UGAFODE loan because he is predicting that his business will be self sustainable.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Volodimyr

texts.en:
Volodimyr is married and has two children. He works as a construction worker and is a specialist in the construction of valves. Volodimyr is an open and hardworking person. 

Volodimyr lives with his family in a two-room apartment. He is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to do renovation in the bathroom. He wants to change the water pipes and put tiles on the walls.  The loan will help to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do renovation in the bathroom

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is mother of three kids. She pays rent and she is selling women's clothes to survive. She is also starting to sell perfume. Nemia needs a loan to buy more women's clothing for her business. She is healthy. She works hard and she hopes you can help her because she goes to many fairs and she makes a big effort to sell her products because of her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José es un joven de 26 años de edad, trabajador, comprometido, José debido a las condiciones económicas no pudo asistir a una universidad, aprovecho su juventud y se convirtió en emprendedor, en un empresario para apoyar a sus padres. 

José de dedica a la venta de alimentos, tiene tres puestos de comidas rápidas, genera dos empleos, vive feliz, en su vivienda están mejor, comen bien, en el momento todo marcha muy bien. 

José en su negocio tiene un inconveniente, sus puestos de alimentos no cuentan con una carpa por ende cuando hay un fuerte aguacero no vende ya que sus clientes no tienen donde refugiarse de la lluvia, por ello José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de tres carpas para sus negocios.
texts.en:
