Jose, 26, is a hard-working, committed young man.  For economic reasons he was unable to go to college but took advantage of his youth to become an entrepreneur.  Now he is a business owner supporting his parents.

Jose sells food and has three fast food stands and two employees.  He lives happily because his family is better off, eating well and life is good.

The inconvenience Jose has is that he has no canopies for his stands so when it rains the customers stay away and sales are down.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy three canopies for his business.

loans.use: To buy three canopies for his business.

loans.name: Jhon Edgar

texts.es:
Jhon un joven de 19 años de edad, una persona con futuro, talentoso, creativo, un empresario que quiere aprovechar su juventud para estudiar y generar dinero, tiene un negocio de elaboración de piezas, esculturas, muebles en acrílico y vidrio (cristal). 

Los ingresos que genera en su negocio los tiene destinados primeramente para pagar sus estudios y el resto para llevar un mercado de alimentos a su hogar, apoya a su madre en todo lo que pueda es un joven muy humilde y solidario.

 Jhon quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales, principalmente, vidrios, aluminio, metal, acrílico. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios, ser un profesional, crear una gran empresa, con empleados y exportando a estados unidos.
texts.en:
Jhon, 19, is a young man with a future.  He is talented and creative, and as a business owner wants to take advantage of his youth to study and generate money.  His business is making sculptures and furniture out of acrylic and glass.

Most of his income is used for his education and the rest for food for his household.  He helps his mother in everything he can, being a very humble, supportive son.

Jhon is requesting a loan to buy materials, mainly glass, aluminum, metal and acrylic.  His dream is to finish his education and become a professional.  He wants to create a large business, hire employees and export to the United States.

loans.use: To buy materials, especially glass, aluminum, metal and acrylic.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced. She lives with her mother in a house. Oksana has her own small business. She is a very hardworking and responsible person. 

Her previous Kiva loan helped her to buy household chemicals, detergents and cosmetics. This time she is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to change three windows and insulate the walls in her house.  The loan will help to keep warmth inside of the house and reduce expenses in the winter.

loans.use: to change three windows and insulate the walls in her house

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona sencilla, honesta, laboriosa, vive en un hogar junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos que son dos mujeres y un hombre.

El señor Nelson tiene un taller de mecánica con el cual produce el sustento para su familia.

Nelson tiene como sueño pagar la educación de sus hijos, aspira a que sean unos profesionales, uno de sus hijos gusta mucho de su profesión, lo está capacitando y enseñando la pasión que tiene por los vehículos para que en un futuro tome las riendas del negocio familiar. 

Nelson espera que su negocio siga mejorando, aumente sus clientes, mejorar sus ganancias.

Nelson quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de repuesto de vehículos y láminas de parachoques. 

Estos son los insumos que más tiene rotación en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelson is a simple, honest, industrious person who lives with his wife and three children: two daughters and a son.  He has an auto repair shop and earns a living this way to support his family.

Nelson's dream is to pay for his children's education so they can become professionals.  One of his sons likes the repair business so he is training him and transmitting his passion for cars so that one day he can take over the family business.

Nelson wants to continue improving his business, attract more customers and improve his profits.  The loan he is requesting is to buy auto spare parts and bumper metal.  These are the supplies with the highest turnover in his business.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tunkuna Village. Adamu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Adamu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to provide good healthcare for his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Adamu will have access to the best farm inputs on the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Adamu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Mwanahamisi...

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. All her kids are still in school. She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 6am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanahamisi's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, repay her loan and cover household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe store.  She dreams of opening another mamalishe in a different place. 

Mwanahamisi will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village. Samaila joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to the best farm inputs on the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samaila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields
